Reviews.Title: “The best kind of small luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: dc-cajun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge for our 15th anniversary weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. The front desk and bell staff were warm, friendly and so helpful. Our room was just perfect - I think it's the one in our guidebook. Great bed with squishy pillows and good shower with sunflower shower head for rain-style shower, in addition to regular nozzle. In room 103, the street noise is quite apparent. The antique windows, while lovely, do not seal out the traffic and trains. We went over to Gaspar for our complimentary evening cocktail and stayed for two more, then we came back to this tavern for post-dinner cocktails. Breakfast was included and quite delicious - omelet cooked to order with potatoes. The location is perfect for walking around the vieux port area, close to the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ChrisVergennes
Reviews.Content: The spatious and comfortable loft at Auberge du Vieux-Prot was the perfect way to spend a weekend get-away with my wife for our anniversary. The staff was hospitable and helpful. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Centrally located in the Vieux-Port, we had easy access to the waterfront, shops, and restaurants. Chris H Vergennes, Vermont

Reviews.Title: “Pretty rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Scott X
Reviews.Content: Very charming inn, awesome location. This was a great place to be if you want to walk around old Montreal. Staff was extremely helpful and polite. Our room was pretty with a nice view toward the water. The bathroom was lovely. The hotel does encourage conservation (i.e. reducing frequency of washing towels and sheets) which is great. But they should leave more than 2 towels for the shower. As one reviewer mentioned, there is a train that comes through late-night that might wake you. Other things this hotel could improve: breakfast, while included, is not great. I would rather have fewer choices (excellent coffee and local bakery bread/croissant) than several mediocre offerings. The complimentary welcome cocktail is a nice idea, but would be better if it were freely offered in the lounge, rather than giving each guest a coupon to exchange at the bar. If they offered it in the lounge, they could provide beer and wine and would seem lovely and generous, rather than having an awkward conversation between bartender and guests as they hand over their coupon in the bar ("This is only good for house wine and draught beer.") Aside from those things, we truly enjoyed our time here. Stone walls, wood floors, and rustic wood beams made for a romantic, old-time atmosphere. We would return on a future visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “THE most charming hotel in all of Old MontrÃ©al!”
Reviews.Author: intheTDOT
Reviews.Content: I just returned from one night at the Auberge, and I must say that the rooms are top notch and so rustic, the service is incredible, the food and drink and just fantastic!! I called in advance to let them know that my American friends were just completing a tour around the world finishing in Montreal, and the left them chocolates, red wine and a card signed by the entire staff. I could not be more pleased, and more proud in my choice of l'Auberge! Merci!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but poor bed and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: buddahbaker
Reviews.Content: This small hotel does have vintage charm, although it is a bit tired. The hotel staff comprises of just two persons (concierge and valet), and the service they deliver is exemplary. However, there are two reasons we won't be returning - the uncomfortable beds and the pub-style breakfast that is included. We were in the new section the first night, and changed rooms to the original section for the remainder of our stay. The King bed in the new section was soft and lumpy, but the main reason we changed rooms was because the new rooms (added on last summer) are so narrow, with long walls, one could barely walk around the end of the bed. We felt like we were sleeping in a hallway. The older rooms are large and square, but the mattress in this Riverside King deluxe was completely shot - when you sat on it one side had no support at all. We had such poor sleep on this bed, and this combined with the cargo train that runs in the middle of the night below the hotel along the river, made for miserable sleeps. We did not complain to the hotel staff about the terrible bed, because we were told when we changed rooms the second day, that this was all that was available. The breakfast that is included is certainly not up to the expected standard of a four star hotel or boutique hotel (to those that say it is free - let me say that nothing is free- it is factored into the costs). The continental buffet consists of cornflakes, commercial sliced bread, and some days commercial mini croissants and orange juice, and packets of cheap jam and artificial honey (didn't know this even existed).You could also order a plate of bacon, eggs, fried potatoes. There sorely needs to be available on the buffet - yogurt, fresh fruit, artisanal breads that are healthy and interesting, and decent croissants/pastries, cheese, and quality preserves.There are many wonderful local bakeries in Montreal from which to source great products. Ditch the offering of fried potatoes and eggs. Let people order this extra if they want it. I don't eat this way at home, and when I travel I expect a four star will offer not only a higher standard of edibles, but also some smarter choices for their guests. The coffee needs an upgrade as well. In the end, there is no amount of spectacular service that can win me over without a comfortable bed and a healthier breakfast offering.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BritishGuyInToronto
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel, having stayed there last year. It's set in a beautiful heritage stone building in Old Montreal with easy access to restaurants and bars. Definitely grab a drink/meal in the attached Taverne Gaspar (http://www.tavernegaspar.com/) as the food was amazing (happy hour $2 oysters!) Michael at the front desk, was extremely friendly and very helpful. Free cooked breakfast was included, plus a free drink and free Internet access in the lobby and free Wi-Fi. That's a lot of free in my book. Avoid the Italian restaurant behind the hotel. They offered "roasted red pepper soup" but it tasted like Heinz Tomato Soup from a can. Used to eat that as a kid all the time, so I know the taste. Tip: Want to eat at Chuck Hughes' Garde Manger (http://www.chuckhughes.ca/) ... even when fully booked? Try tweeting him and asked to be squeezed in -- worked for us! One of the best meals of the trip, fantastic food. All in all, book this hotel and great things seem to happen :-) Cheers, John.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junebug1984
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Easter long weekend and have absolutely no complaints. The room was very nice and vintage looking with hard wood floors, a rain shower, and the most comfortable bed ever. We got the King River View on the 4th floor and it was well worth it. I here the street view is noisy and we didnâ€™t hear too much noise at night on the river side. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They can help you with dinner reservations, things to do, shopping etc. There is a breakfast at the restaurant bar that is included every morning. They set out toast, mini croissants, cereal and milk, juice, jam, peanut butter and coffee. Then you can order from a menu which had omelets, French toast, eggs any way and crepes (this is also included). There is valet parking which is $28 per night. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Michael Made the Difference”
Reviews.Author: rcmimages
Reviews.Content: Right from the start, Michael at the front desk made us feel welcomed. The entire staff were loquacious and very friendly. My fiance and I spent a lot of time with the staff asking questions and exchanging stories. Other reviews mention the hotel's old world charm; this cannot be understated. The rooms are exceptional; nice size, hardwood floors, exposed brick, vaulted beamed ceilings, a "rain" shower and nice amenities. The breakfast, served right off the lobby in the Gaspar Tavern(Taverne Gaspar), is not elaborate by any means, but is an adequate start to the day and included in the room charge. The location in old Montreal over looking the Saint Lawrence River and Port is excellent. A metro, art galleries, restaurants, shopping, Notre-Dame Basilica, Igloofest (January) and many other attractions and conveniences wait just around the corner within walking distance. We were there in January during some snow storms and found so much to do including Snow Village (January-March), the Montreal Botanical Garden, Habitat 67, Schwartz's Deli, Westmount, St-Viateur Bagel, and Casino de Montreal. I am looking forward to returning one day; will probably visit during a different season to see the contrast. And you can bet that I'll be staying at the Auberge du Vieux-Port Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Experience Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Richard I
Reviews.Content: (I sent this letter to the hotel manager after my 3 night stay at the Auberge du Vieux-Port in August 2011) I had the pleasure of staying at Auberge Vieux Port for the second consecutive summer this past week. I wanted to express my sincere satisfaction and appreciation for services that were provided me by your staff professionals that exceeded my expectations. You should know that my profession is business development and I am a well-seasoned sales professional as sales-trainer. I have spent many years instructing staff as to professional service and follow-through always meeting and exceeding client expectations every single time, with every single guest, every single time...whether you feel like it, or not. As a sales professional and business development director, I know that the best way to make your clients happy is to meet their expectations. The best way to ensure client loyalty is to consistently meet or exceed their expectations. The best way to make your clients "word-of-mouth-referral-machines" is to provide them a memorable experience. The following professionals provided me memorable experiences worthy of great praise for their absolute attention to detail: Front-Desk, Trifon Boumbovski is the best experience I have had of a well-trained service professional in many years. He went beyond expectations in that he was attentive and responsive to my needs displaying a willingness to do whatever necessary to make me feel right at home. He gracefully managed 2-to-3 guests at one time meeting their needs while providing a sense of attention and focus. Trifon made a tough job in working with the individual needs of every single guest seem easy. He also has a pleasantly disarming sense of humor and respect. Mathieu Verronneau - Valet was attentive, responsive and anticipated my needs. There is a certain uneasiness that I feel handing my car keys to what moments ago was a perfect stranger. Mathieu immediately went beyond expectations in providing me comfort and follow-through of every minor request that I made. He gave me the immediate sense that all would be taken care of in regards to my car, my luggage and my initial walk-in to my room. Eric Bellavance - Restaurant - exceeded my expectations in tireless efforts to please and create a unique dinning environment. He was responsice yet not intrusive. He was eager to please and meet my needs while providing exceptionally quick service. These service professionals - Trifon, Mathieu and Eric - are 3 reason why I will refer guests to Auberge Vieux Port. You should be commended on your professional insight to work with and develop the talents of these service professionals. Their respective dedication to detail and excellence reflects well upon you as well as Auberge Vieux Port. Your operation is exceptional. I will recommend your hotel and will continue to return to Auberge Vieux Port for many more years. With gratitude for creating an environment and experience that well surpassed my expectation!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GlennzWife
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here last weekend during one of the few snowstorms of the season. Even with the snow we had a great stay as the location is fantastic - everything is within easy walking distance. The staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. Everyone we encountered was absolutely top-notch. The room was lovely - a little old world charm with modern amenities. Had a nice breakfast each morning - tavern connected to the restaurant - with cocktails available in the evening. We will definitely stay here again when we hit the bike path this summer. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011and had a wonderful experience. We booked a Queen deluxe that faced St Paul Street in the back. I wasn't one of the "old" rooms that everyone raves about, but the room was very nice and modern with an interesting contrast of an exposed brick wall. The room had beautiful hardwood floors with modern furniture and fixtures and high ceilings. You could open the windows on to the street, which along with the brick makes it more unique than a big chain hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable, nice linens, robes and slippers, nice bath amenities, rain-shower (no tub). The room was a little on the long and narrow side, but overall very nice - you're supposed to be out and about anyway. One note about the gorgeous hardwood floors though is that you hear everything: cleaning staff in the halls, high-heels in the room next door â€“ or above you. If you are a light sleeper (which we arenâ€™t) you might want earplugs. We didnâ€™t experience much of a noise problem from the street as other reviewers mentioned but we were on the 4th floor. The location is great â€“ VERY central, walking distance to many major attractions, and close to the Metro. The metro is very easy to use, and I would recommend taking it over a cab if your destination is close to a stop. Cabs are also easy to get in the area, and the staff can help book one for you if you like. The staff were all very friendly, but I canâ€™t say enough good things about the front desk staff. They were extremely helpful and informative, and helped arrange reservations for us at some great restaurants. Jocelyn (sp?) in particular was fantastic and made some great recommendations for places to eat, as well as some tips for activities we already had in mind. Our rate also included free WiFi and a complimentary breakfast and happy hour drink each day. Nice! I would definitely stay here again in Montreal. Itâ€™s a lovely hotel with wonderful staff. If I went back, I would probably try to book one of the older rooms (since people rave about them) facing the water.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities & old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Muse208
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous little gem in the heart of Old Montreal, within walking distance of great restaurants and entertainment for children (museum) and adults alike. Staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Rooms had exposed brick, high ceilings and hardwood - rustic but modern. Stayed in suite facing river and rented loft for extended stay as well - both great experiences. Continental breakfast included. Would not hesitate to stay here in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Carroll92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position in the heart of old Montreal. Very comfortable beds and nice fittings. There are loads of restaurants and things to explore around the port. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: coolich
Reviews.Content: From the second I walked through the door this staff of this hotel made me feel at home. Everyone treated me and my wife great! The hotel room was very large and very cozy. The duvets are so comfy! We did not want to leave our beds when we woke up. The staff are TOP NOTCH!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOTravelerEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights from Feb 18 to Feb 20. A very small property in the Old Montreal area but very well appointed and absolutely charming. The staff was attentive and friendly and provided excellent service. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “First Getaway to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: acstutts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights this past weekend. After retaing some reviews..... we were a bit apprehensive, but from the first moment we arrived at the hotel we were at ease. Michaele greeted us at the door and was so friendly. He always went out of his way to help us and make sure our stay was going well. We felt as if we had known him forever. Then there was our concierge upon arrival.... his name was Trifon and he did an excellent job at recommending restaurants and things to see while we were in Montreal. These two employees are a huge asset to the Auberge du Viuex Port. The breakfast was not elaborate..... but quite nice and of course is included in your stay..... so who can complain about that. Any concerns we had were addressed immediately and the employees always seemed genuinely concerned about us. We would definitely stay here again if we come back to Montreal! Oh.... and by the way..... the bed was super comfortable in Room 302 which was a premier river view king bed room. It was lovely. Thanks again to Michaele and Trifon for making our stay so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a weekend in Montreal at this great hotel. Location was perfect for walking to almost anywhere in Old Montreal (shopping, restaurants, historical sites). The rooms were lovely and in keeping with the local flavour. The staff were wonderful, both helpful and accomodating. Only one problem. We didn't want to leave! This hotel was everything we were looking for and more. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location; Classy, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marc B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated in Old Montreal and along the waterfront, a truly outstanding location. Plus the hotel's public. There is a nice balance of elegance and warm charm to the hotel -- overall the hotel's public areas and room are classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great style!”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully restored and has a lot of charm. The front desk/concierge was TREMONDOUSLY helpful getting us into two wonderful restaurants. The hotel restaurant was only used for breakfasts but it was very pleasant and good food. The location is superb for walking the riverside as well as shopping and restaurants. I'm not sure there is a side of the hotel to recommend for quietness from the street noise - we're picky about that and it wasn't too bad. Highly recommend this hotel for a tourist visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MartinMihaylov
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the lofts beginning of Jan 2012 and my experience was more than great. Very exclusive, but yet cosy feeling starting with the check-in to having my suitcase brought to the car to the airport. People are extremely nice, especially Trifon who made our stay unforgettable. Definite recommendation for people with a sense on style that are tired of the standard hotel room and look for real old town experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent rooms, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A N
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a long weekend and had a really nice time. The rooms in the new wing were beautiful, and we got to peek into the wing that wasn't redone last year and (though they were less modern in design) were gorgeous, too. They've done a great job of incorporating the old stonework into the new--we loved the decor (especially in comparison to some of the other hotels in the area). The service was great, really helpful and always very friendly. We had a minor issue and Michael and the rest of the team took really good care of us. The restaurant/bar on the side of the hotel was always busy (in a good way) and had a really good vibe. Overall, just a really nice boutique hotel that gave off a feeling of being in a small inn, but in the middle of everything and with everything you could ask for. And internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGnomeFarm
Reviews.Content: We booked through an online agency - and entered a note about our anniversary. To confirm, I called the hotel. They not only had our anniversary information - they had upgraded our room to help us celebrate! Frederick met us at the door - and was the most perfect valet/general greeter/font of knowledge and kindness. Make sure you take advantage of the valet service. Frederick secured our car and then magically reappeared to bring our bags to our room. Next we met the wonderful Mylene - the concierge and reception. I cannot convey how wonderful the staff are here. Mylene checked us in, gave us fabulous event advice, restaurant advice, and called our room to make sure everything was perfect. Today we met two more staff, Daniel and Trefon. Again - couldn't be more helpful. Wonderful room overlooking the river. Fabulous location. Relatively close to the metro - but far enough away to be very quiet. All of the staff expertly switch between languages as needed. Fabulous restaurants nearby. Mylene and Trefon suggested several. Daniel served breakfast. - Wonderful crepes. Very romantic getaway - if you like history, a building with charm and value the inherent kindness of people!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in September 2011 for 5 nights. Overall it was excellent. We paid extra for one of the River View rooms and I am glad we did. Based on the Trip Advisor reviews we requested a room in the older part of the hotel, which they accommodated. The rooms are lovely -- they feel warm and homey, not cold and impersonal like some other hotels. Beds are ridiculously comfortable. Bathroom was great -- clean and spacious. The service was good, though the reception area is very small and often with only one staff person working the desk -- so some patience is required. The breakfast that's included is excellent, and the rooftop is lovely. My only other comment is that as a couple in our early 30's the clientele seemed a bit older - so if you are looking for a hip and happening hotel, this is not it. This hotel has a more classic, romantic feel and they are very good at catering to people who want this type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have stayed in a number of really nice Montreal hotels over the years - this one ranks as our new favourite. Excellent service, accomodations, price and location - will definitely try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, but usually can't afford to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: globalbouncer
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the quintessential Old Montreal hotel- it's exactly what you imagine when you think of this area of the city- quaint, pretty, romantic & historical. The rooms are nice with some of them having brick walls and a really great ambience and great views of the port. I would love to go to this hotel more often, but the rates are pretty steep, especially in the summer. The location is fantastic if you don't mind being in Old Montreal and taking the metro (a 5-10 min. walk from the hotel) to the other areas of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and views-”
Reviews.Author: jamie j
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent the weekend here and would go back tonight. Others reviews are right to say the internet and radio dosent work well-but thats simply a problem of choosing the wrong technology supplier. Amazing Room. we stayed on the top level with a spectacular view of the river and old port boats. I work in the old port and have driven by a thousand times and never new of such a gem untill my wife found the booking for us. Rooftop terrace is a bit unrefined but matches all the other rooftops around. Service was excellent at the desk, though when i called because the jucuzzi air jets would not turn off at 11:30 at night there was no rush on there part and i ended up just fixing it myself!! Suprised that its only 3.5 stars- The area in the blocks around is the place to be -rue des artistes and attractions galore- Perfect Location!! Breakfast was excellent-

Reviews.Title: “The auberge is growing but quality is going down :(”
Reviews.Author: Billy43William
Reviews.Content: I am writting this review from the auberge's bed which is very comfortable! (the pillow is a bit high for the neck but no other complaint on bedding) It is my third stay at the hotel and we have been staying in the new section, room 212. As of a few minutes ago, our electronic key card wouldn't let us in our room (which, i know, isn't a rare occurrence at hotels in general). Also, we did not receive a Newspaper at our door this morning. The room looks good but is narrower than the old one thus making it feel a bit small. The window and rock wall is also smaller. The rest of the room is well decorated. The new washroom looks good. Shower is well made with nice tile floor. There is some kind of publicity going through the TV at regular intervals which is annoying even when just watching the weather channel! Breakfast was a Fiasco! We got there at 10:30 and were received by a very busy waiter. He made us wait at least 10 minutes in the entrance to then be advised that breakfast was closing at 10:30 as the only cook didn't have time to prepare anything else since he had to get ready for lunch. We had the rest of continental breakfast which consists of toast, coffee and cereal, quite a let down. We were not the only clients disappointed by this. We were also surrended by dirty plates and bowls as the waiter didn't have time to clean after clients left. I can't blame the waiter for this problem but the hotel had definitely lost my business at that point. We then decided to go see the roof terrace as we wanted to shoot a few pictures. There weren't any signs indicating if the terrace was closed or not! The door was unlocked. IF YOU HAVE CHILDREN, MAKE SURE THEY ARE SUPERVISED IF THEY GO THERE because deck is, for one, very slippery and there aren't any railings on the side which is very dangerous, let me remind you that the terrace is on the fifth floor! Besides the breakfast service, front desk, car valet and room service staff were very polite. I do believe that this will be my last stay at this hotel. At this price, the hotel is overrated and the roof terrace issue could be a major danger for your kids.

Reviews.Title: “A rooom with a view...”
Reviews.Author: geo2urist
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights in Montreal at the Auberge du-Vieux Port in the old part of the city. We tend to stay in properties that are historic and give you a real sense-of-place. This property nailed it! Our room over looked the St. Lawrence River and seaport in "Old Montreal" which is definitely the place to stay if you are visiting Montreal and want to experience the authenticity of this city. Our room was cozy, historic (big wooden ceiling beams, wooden floors, high ceilings) with just the right amount of modern conveniences (the coffee maker was an espresso machine)! The in-room amenities were very nice especially the bathrobes (we had a River View King Premier room which included a great shower and jacuzzi tub). A full breakfast or continental breakfast was included every morning and served in the Gaspar Tavern which is attached to the hotel day (I don't normally like to eat my breakfast in a bar, but the atmosphere in this pub was delightful) The full breakfast included everything from eggs every which way to French Crepes and French toast. In the evening they serve a combination of very good French & English "comfort food" not to mention a wonderful variety of regional wines, beers and liquor. Other GREAT restaurants are within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly, efficient and fluent in several languages. This small hotel has a warm and welcoming ambiance, is very clean, and conveniently located. The old part of the city is known for its restaurants, shopping and general sightseeing and it certainly lived up to those expectations. If you want to venture off to explore other parts of the city, the subway station is within walking distance of this small (27 room) quaint historic hotel. The only "downside" that I could see might be that our room faced the rue de la Commune which may be noisy in the summer if you have the windows open but I would definitely stay here again! P.S. There is also a terrace on the roof which was not open at this time of year but it looked like a great place to relax and have a cocktail...the views from up there would be spectacular. P.S.S. We also made a trip to the Rain Spa for massages and a facial, The message was fabulous, the facial was nice, but I have had better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: caroopal
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room on the 2nd floor with high beamed ceilings. There were floor to ceiling windows, a beautiful bathroom and comfortable bed. The front desk loaned my boyfriend an iPad to play with while I got ready, and the concierge even drove us to our dinner reservation! The complimentary cocktail and breakfast the next day were the icing on top of the cake. Absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: dolphinOntario
Reviews.Content: we read up on the hotel and it sounded perfect. It was nice, but I would not say that it earned all of its stars. A bit of confusion over the booking, but when we got to the room it was a very generous size. as others have mentioned - pros and cons: the bed was comfy, the bath and shower were huge, free breakfast included. But the phone and cd/MP3 player were not working properly, the tv had mainly French channels and no guide to channels, supplies were not properly replisnished (coffee, toiletries), furniture a little banged up. worst was that we had room overlooking the street behind the building, Not sure what they can do about it, but obviously the bars close at either 1 am or 3 am, and we were woken up each time by very loud (i.e. singing) partiers under our windows. maybe soundproof windows?

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic break in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: DexMex
Reviews.Content: Our king room with river view was gorgeous. They put us in the new section and, although the room did not seem as big as some of the king rooms we saw online (probably original section), it was perfect for our 3 nights there. We loved the shower with the jets, the wood floors, and the bed was so ridiculously comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly. Their new restaurant was actually just opening during our stay. The hotel concierge invited us to pass by their opening event for a drink. Beautiful space. We went back the next night for dinner. It was a little quieter, but their comfort-style food was very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “almost ruined the birthday of my girlfriend.”
Reviews.Author: kevinbel
Reviews.Content: Check in was very good... The day before our reservation I asked for a room change (king, river view, 4 floor or more) but it was booked so he upgraded my reservation to a king premier room. GREAT until the big multi-jet shower felt of the wall on my girlfriend head. They asked us if we wanted to move in another room and we said no because we will take a bath. So we go out eat in a reataurant near the hotel and we came back we took a bath in the jacuzzi and when we drained the water at 1AM, we received a call... it flooded the room on fourth and third floor. The night advisor suggested to move to another room(regular queen size) so we did change room. My girlfriend was really upset. A night at this hotel was part of my gift to my girlfriend. This ruined the night at the hotel. The staff was very helpfull and did a great job. They gave us a reduction. The room are very nice and I think it was bad timing but things like that should not happen...

Reviews.Title: “2nd warning to beware of bait and switch in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Caterina_Toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Auberge in early November. We were celebrating my birthday and chose your hotel based on a great stay we had there last year. This year's experience was however markedly differentl. We booked the same accommodation as last year, a deluxe loft, online and received written confirmation of our booking in advance of our arrival. When we arrived on Friday evening, we were however told that all of the deluxe lofts were booked and we were being upgraded to a larger room. When we walked over to this room with the concierge and climbed 7 floors imagine our surprise to find, while a much larger room with 2 bedrooms, a room that was VERY cold ( no heat was on and a window was open), the couch was soiled, the phone was not working and the bathroom was very outdated. When we asked if we could use the fireplace we were told - no sorry, not yet. Our concierge, recognizing the obvious disappointment on our faces, offered to see what he could do for us. Upon his return in 15 mins we moved to a smaller more modern room as this was our only other option, after another walk and climb up another seven flights. To add insult to injury, we listened to partiers in the laneway for much of what was left of the night and then the garbage/recycling trucks at 6 a.m. It was one of the worst sleeps I've ever experienced. We raised these concerns with front desk staff on Saturday morning and they offered us a room facing the river in the Inn once guests had checked out - and bumping some other guests who had booked this room. After two more trips to the front desk that morning, we did switch rooms and atleast this enabled us to get a good night's sleep. I asked the staff several times over the weekend if they could explain what had happened to our reservation and they were not able to, although they were polite and told me that they has asked the Asst Mgr. I've contacted the inn a few more times since arriving home, and they have provided no response. If you care about the room you book I'd recommend booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable inn in the heart of Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: cs79
Reviews.Content: Everyone working at the Auberge du Vieux-Port is friendly, kind, and helpful. We felt welcome from the moment we walked in the door. The bed was supremely comfortable, we loved the exposed brick and beams in the room, the updated rainspa shower was heavenly. And the location is perfect for walking around the port and old town. They could have put a latch on the bathroom door so it would actually close, but we were willing to overlook this. Taverne Gaspar downstairs is new, seemed to be pretty popular even on a weeknight, and has a good selection of drinks and food. The free breakfast is fantastic and we loved the welcome drinks. They do provide valet parking for $25/night. Warning though: If you are a light sleeper or not used to noise in the night, do not get a room overlooking Rue St. Paul. We live in a city and we still were up half the night from trucks and construction on the road. It is extremely noisy, so pay the extra for a port-facing room!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Montreal for the money”
Reviews.Author: backtolyme
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, location is the best in Montreal, and the rooms are very nice, comfortable and clean. Too many great restaurants in the area to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, beautiful building but many cautions”
Reviews.Author: RoccoInOC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge du Vieux-Port in July, during Canada Day, July 4 and the Jazz Fest. The location of the property is great, no question about that. It can be a very nice, boutique hotel, depending on the room they decide to give you. We reserved a room with a view of the port and river, but the first room they put us in was in the "new part of the hotel". Don't stay in this section. The rooms are small, low ceilings and no view at all. It took a couple moves to get us to what we thought we had booked in advance and paid for. Our final room was great, I have to admit. A nice view of the river and Canada Day celebrations below. The restaurant downstairs, while it looks nice, has sub-par service. They were understaffed and generally not very interested in their guests. Michael at the front desk was great and very accommodating. The bar staff couldn't be bothered. We were disappointed when we were told no problem to book Circque Du Soleil tickets on a Monday by the front desk. We listened to them only to find out there are no shows on Mondays. We were both very disappointed with that lack of attention to detail. Overall, it's a nice property in a great location but be wary of your room location and don't expect too much in terms of service. We would consider staying here again, but would be very careful in knowing exactly what room we would have.

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: gr4Calgary
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location! Very professional staff willing to go over and above to make your stay memorable. We stayed in the older rooms and they had all the old world charm with new world conveniences. Walking distance to many restaurants, stores and must see sites like the Notre-Dame Basilique. Old Town Montreal is a definite must see and front desk staff will give great tips and make sure you go to the right places.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: Naveron
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly and welcoming small hotel in Old Montreal. Here is a quick run down: Good points: Location is excellent as a base for Old Montreal The staff are very friendly and helpful The adjoining restaurant "Gaspar" is very good, with a nice bar. The included breakfast is yummy. The beds are extremely confortable, the showers very high tech. A couple of not so good points: This is a hotel where your choice of room make a big difference. Avoid the standard Queen rooms for the following reasons: 1. Very small 2. No view 3. Awkward location, literally between floors, so you have to use stairs regardless of whether you use the elevator 4. Noisy floors. The woman next door to us was rushing around in the early morning, obviously wearing heels. It sounded like she was in our room! 5. Housekeeping: It could have been a bit better. There were lots of dead small flies on the bathroom floor I think this hotel has done a great job of working around its structural limitations but it's worth paying a bit more for a better room, it will make your stay that much nicer. This hotel has made the best of its structural limitations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: markus1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Old Montreal and is very charming. The staff is very informative and friendly. They will help you plan you evening or give you any tips to make your stay in MTL better. The rooms are rustic and modern at the same time. The new opening of Gaspar lounge makes for a great place for dinner or just drinks. The bartenders and staff are great to interact with and make for a very enjoyable evening. Personally I want to thank them for making our trip to MTL such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice views, lots of genuine character”
Reviews.Author: 2SLOTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the old port and one street away from bustling rue Saint Paul with its many restaurants and other attractions, this is a stylish boutique hotel with spacious rooms and lots of amenities. I think we read the hotel is re-purposed from a former warehouse; it certainly exudes character and a certain charm. Ours was a deluxe king room on the fifth floor with brick walls, hardwood floors, loads of space, a great bed, and a giant bathroom featuring a multi-jet shower. The room was quiet and had a 180 degree view of the port and river - well worth the slight extra cost based on a quick look into a couple of non-view rooms. Some parts of the nearby neighborhood are a bit shoddy, but all in all it's a great location within easy walking distance of lots of desirable attractions, and is perfect for those who choose not to have a car. Breakfast, served in the roomy ground floor bistro, is included and has lots of offerings from grab-and-go to fully cooked choices. The front desk staff is extremely helpful, over-the-top friendly, yet totally professional. We were contacted by e-mail a day before arrival with a welcoming message and were likewise thanked for our stay a few days after departure â€“ classy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: RMerel
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed, though this is a very nice hotel with good location on the river, in Old Montreal. Five months in advance, we booked a special room for 4 nights(2@$250, 2@$188), from photos on the website "King deluxe river view: elegant decor....timbered ceilings, brick and stone walls,large casement windows with unparalleled views of the old port and the river", etc. When we arrived, we were showed to a smaller room in the "new section", with very ordinary modern furniture, low ceilings, and one small window. No apologies, no rate reduction offered. The room we had reserved was not available. When I persisted, we obtained a room similar to what we'd reserved, but on the street side, where drunken revelers disturbed our sleep until 3 AM, at only a $20 daily reduction. When I complained more, a few days later, I received an additional $90 reduction off the bill. I would have preferred one night's free stay. But I got the impression we were not the first clients who had been treated this way. If you reserve a specific room type, and that's the reason you choose a hotel, you should be guaranteed what you were promised. Had we not shown up to claim our reservation, I assume we would've been charged full price for a room that we weren't going to receive if he had shown up!! So hesitate before you leap...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shagriff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Oct 2011 for 3 nights, we had a room on the 5th floor with wonderful views. Very comfortable bed and linens, no tub but a great shower. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It's in a great location, in the old port area of Montreal, close to shops and restaurants, you can walk to a lot of area attractions. We didn't have any problems with the hotels wi-fi, breakfast is pretty good, cereal, croissants, fruit plus a few hot choices such as omelets, crepes or eggs and bacon. We valet parked, $25 per night, the lot is about a half mile from the hotel. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Michisw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at auberge de Vieux-Port for three nights and would not recommend it for several reasons. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because it advertised wireless Internet. However we were never able to connect to the Internet. Every person we spoke to gave us a different reason ranging from apple products don't work at the hotel, another guest was doing massive downloads, the signal was not string on our room, the hotel walks are too thick etc. In addition to Internet problems there was no safe in our room. They seemed quite surprised when I couldn't find the safe, then the concierge came up and couldn't find it either hmmmm, I wonder where it went. Our TV also didn't work for a day. The wall between our room (103) and the room next door was so thin we were able to hear the couple next doors complete conversation without lite ing. I can tell you they were catching an early plane to Nova Scotia. Having said all that I will tell you our room was beautiful, the location was great and the staff was lively. Thet just were unable to solve problems satisfactorily .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCOUPLESANDIEGO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Auberge du Vieux-Port for 3 nights post cruise at the end of September and enjoyed our stay. The room #201, was large with very high ceilings and the bathroom was very nice with great shower head(s). The hotel is right in the center of the old port district with lots of shopping and eating only a few steps away. If we ever make back to Montreal again, we would certainly stay here again. Across the street from the water front and you are able to walk everywhere. Breakfast was good with several choices besides the buffet. The front desk was terrific and helped us several times with tours and getting us a cab very early in the morning. I had no trouble with the wireless internet, so maybe they were having routers troubles at other times.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Lovely”
Reviews.Author: westielover_TO
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Auberge du Vieux-Port, which overlooks the water in Old Montreal. Our first trip a year ago was in the biting cold of winter & although we loved the hotel even then, we definitely loved it better this time around in the height of summer, with the lovely horse-drawn carriages & all the bustle & beauty of Old Montreal & its gorgeous cobblestone streets in summertime. This is a small boutique hotel & the bedrooms & bathrooms are consistently beautiful, comfortable, & luxurious. The floor-to-ceiling french doors opening to juliette balconies are so very French, that you actually think you might be in Paris! The staff have been wonderful, cheerful & helpful, every time we've been there. And not only is breakfast included, but every evening they have a wine & cheese type reception (we had a live jazz band last winter too) & you're entitled to a free alcoholic beverage of your choice every night. My husband & I would definitely go back there for all our future trips to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, exceptional hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JohnandKateBoston
Reviews.Content: Like the most recent reviewers, this is a fantastic hotel. My wife just brought me here to celebrate my 50th birthday, and I can only say great things about the hotel and the entire staff. It's located right on the water in an ideal location right in the heart of Old Montreal. We stayed in room #202, king size bed, great views, 12' high ceiling, well appointed, huge jacuzzi tub, spa like jet shower - everything was wonderful. We stayed for 3 days/2 nights, and had not one complaint. From the time we arrived until the time we left, the service was exceptional. Valet parkng (thanks Frederic) is easy, front desk extremely friendly and helpful (thanks Mylene, Jocely and Renee). A nice breakfast is also included. The hotel also has a wonderful rooftop bar where you can sit and have a coktail overlooking the Old Port, La Ronde and most of the city. You can walk to all the main attractions right from the hotel - Jacques Cartier plaza is literally right next door, Notre Dame cathedral is a 5 minte walk, and you can also walk to literally hundreds of great restaurants and bistros. We talked to some other people who were staying in downtown Montreat and Old Montreal, and for the price you can;t beat it. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Old Montreal, it is well worht it. we are already planning on returning this winter!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charming rooms. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pdotmail
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the water in the old Vieux Port area of Montreal, this is a really nice hotel. It is an older building and our room had lovely high ceilings and tall windows, along with exposed beams and old brick-faced wall. We walked nearly everywhere we wanted to visit. The room was large and well-appointed. Our only complaint was the down comforter was so luxurious and thick we had trouble keeping cool at night. The breakfast in the restaurant was included and adequate, if not really great. A very helpful and friendly staff who are also knowledgeable about the area attractions was another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: Reesee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i checked in to this hotel, right on the water, initially for two days at the end of August. We loved it so much, we added a third day. The hotel is gorgeous, well located, had wonderfully attentive staff, and our room, which included a spa like bath, was amazing. Things i loved, the valet - worked out wonderfully to take on Montreal's old city on foot, with no worries about our car, the room - beautiful w/ a warm down comforter and had a view of the river, but also had doubled paned windows...so quiet and restful...i think our room was 212, the breakfast - buffet and options for crepes, french toast, omelets etc..yum, Hotel Restaurant Narcisse -LOVED the beautiful setting and the food was fresh and fantastic. Other perks - yes this hotel takes AAA. They upgraded us from a Queen to a King with river view. they dropped a day's cost for valet parking b/c we had difficulty using the drain in our very fancy sink (turns out u press the drain down and it pops up/down to close drain), this hotel throws in a complimentary drink for two at either the upstairs terrace (great view of the city) or the restaurant. I thought it was a great 'buy' for its awesome location, the excellent level of service, and the top quality of this hotel. LOVED our experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: jillliebean215
Reviews.Content: This place has an old-world charm with all the comforts of today. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful. Don't miss out on the roof deck bar. The daily breakfast and cocktail hour were added perks to our stay. The hotel is located in a great area with easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Katherine B
Reviews.Content: The hotel can not help but be romantic with the rooms that boast of finishes lovingly preserved. The hotel staff are so friendly, warm and accommodating. It was a very welcoming stay. Auberge du Vieux-Port is right in the middle of Old Montreal, right in the heart of the fun. There is an incredible roof-top terrace at the hotel which over looks the river, it's a great spot to enjoy a beverage. visit http://glamourbeginsathome.blogspot.com/2011/06/montreal-jazz-festival.html for more information and pictures of our visit to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OddNick
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and loved it. From the moment we arrived, the staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. The Conceirge called in her favors and got us impossible reservations at Le Bremner, a brabd-new restaurant. The room, on the 5th floor, was huge, comfortable and had a luxurious bathroom. We were on the street side (Rue St. Paul), but the noise wasn't bad, even on a Friday night. The air conditioning was comfortable but not frigid. I didn't mind, but my wife wasn't crazy about that. We had a package that included breakfast and parking, which made it a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “May Break”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: I took my Wife for her birthday to Montreal and we stayed at the Auberge du Vieux-Port were we had a wonderful fourth floor room overlooking the river. The Hotel Staff were freindly and very helpful. We would recommend this as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing and romantic”
Reviews.Author: krmz
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay...gorgeous clean rooms, romance to die for, wonderful restaurant and a staff that bend over backwards to make sure your stay is first rate..wouldn't stay anywhere else in Montreal..

Reviews.Title: “Hate to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: maryji
Reviews.Content: We have to leave this wonderful hotel tomorrow and really hate to go. The staff is friendly and has a sense of humor. They are very helpful. Our room is beautiful and better than we expected. The hotel is in the heart of Old Montreal and easily within walking distance of cafes, bistros, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are wonderfully helpful - best location!”
Reviews.Author: afm00
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying here and we will be back. Everyone - from check in to leaving went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. Very friendly and sincere people. As we left a sudden rain storm came up and the parking valet and doormen loaded luggage in car and held umbreallas over us while we got in car. The rooms are newly renovated in an old building with loads of atmoshere. Our room was quite small but we were lucky to get a room as they fill up quickly. Try to not stay in room 308 though - there is a large exposed metal beam and pillar in the middle of both the bedroom and the bathroom. The architect messed up the plans a little I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: travelinda20
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to stay here. Hotel rooms are spotless, personnel are attentive and personable, breakfasts (esp chocolate croissants) are delicious. The location is amazing, if you want the feel of a unique hotel and not a high rise in the downtown area. We had a superior king on the 4th floor and were amazed. Wood floors, brick walls, beautiful view overlooking the port, a wonderful updated bathroom...one of my favorite hotel rooms ever! We heard it was romantic, and that is a fantastic description...

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic District (Old Port) Location”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler025
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located for a tourist like me who wanted to see the sights, wander cobblestone streets, go to galleries and cafÃ©s and still be close to â€˜home.â€™ Surprisingly though, the lofts are located a couple of blocks from the main hotel so there is no lobby or housekeeping on site. Our room was like a lovely little apartment complete with kitchenette and a nice sized dining table. On the downside, the 8 flights of stairs (two on each floor of this four story building) could be daunting. Especially after a day of sight-seeing. The view was pretty but I still wouldnâ€™t recommend this top floor unit for the elderly or forgetful (whoops, forgot the camera! Yikes!) Iâ€™m planning on staying in the main hotel along the waterfront on my next upcoming stay.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel that does everything right!”
Reviews.Author: cleem
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to find nice, small hotels with charm, good location, and affordable - this hotel has it all. The service was fabulous from the time we arrived and they took the car to the time we left. There's a full breakfast included in the price. We stayed in the brand new section which was very quiet. The room had lots of charm and the bath had a great, large shower with the rain shower head. There is a rooftop bar that we would have liked to go to but didn't know that it had to be booked ahead of time. Good info if you're planning on going during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms are in the old section!”
Reviews.Author: SALOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a room in the old section facing the river. The room had 2 full length windows that opened for a wonderful breeze. One wall was old brick with a king size bed which was very comfy! The room also had a small kitchenette with a good size fridge. The hotel is in a perfect location for walking to the restaurants and walking over to the river boardwalk and bike path. The Market is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and you can pick up fresh veggies, cheese, meats, wine etc. The restaurant attached to the auberge is exceptional. We had the best supper here during our stay. The menu is very nouveau and pleasing. The hotel staff were bilingual and able to give us good directions and very helpful. The only issue we had , was that the street below our room was very noisy so we could not leave the big windows open during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Extraordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeGriffy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an overnight stay here with my son. It was the first trip for both of us to Montreal. The hotel is in a fantastic spot, right in the heart of the Old Port district. When we arrived we were greeted by Mylene and she was most helpful and accommodating. Then Maxime assisted with our baggage and valet parking (apparently a long way from the hotel). He was very charming. Included in our package was a welcome drink for two as well as a full breakfast this morning which was amazing! We had room 101 with a view of the river. It was a gorgeous room with high ceilings and exposed brick walls with a boutique flair. The bed was the comfiest I've slept in a long while! Today we had Jocelyn at reception who again was very helpful. He allowed us to leave our bags in the room beyond the 12 noon checkout (until 3 p.m.) and also gave us extended parking until that time. When we arrived back at the hotel to check out at 3, Frederic had already picked up my car, brought all our bags from the room, hung my dresses in the car and packed everything up ready to go. All the staff always had a smile and were most helpful. Last night we had a drink on a terrace watching the fireworks display just across the street from the hotel, today we rented bikes a block away, then went to the Science Centre immediately opposite, walked around the shops and had a wonderful lunch on one of the hundreds of outside patios. There's also a rooftop terrace at the hotel. The only possible negative I can think of is that there were no screens on the windows:) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central spot in Old Montreal with great customer service and wonderful accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Longisland6306
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for our anniversary and found everyone from the front desk to the waitstaff and the bellhops extremely helpful. We were first put on the new section of the hotel but my wife wasn't too crazy about it it was very clean and nice but also had a very modern feel to it . The girl at the front desk was extremely helpful and we were moved to the older section of the hotel which was slightly larger and more of what we wanted and overlooked the street which was very entertaining. All in all a very pleasant stay and I would recommend this Hotel for a stay in Montral.

Reviews.Title: “Promised my wife we would return”
Reviews.Author: cenz
Reviews.Content: Surprised my wife with a trip to old montreal for her birthday. Out of all the establishments I have taken her to, this by far is the best of them all! Old world charm.Wonderful staff, the rooms are spacious,immaculate,and well appointed.The breakfasts are awsome and the homebaked croisants are to die for!! Also situated in the heart of all the attractions. You will have dinner at bonnaparte restaurant!!! Please trust me. Bocatta tapas bar is also a must.Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but..”
Reviews.Author: dkfCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely perfectly located. When we arrived and were taken up to our room, it was not ready. We were offered complimentary drinks while we waited. Very nice. The room was in the new wing, so it was in excellent condition. Hardwood floors and exposed brick wall. Bathroom modern with great shower. Now for the but.....the breakfast buffet was the most merger I have seen from a quality hotel. You can order from a menu to augment the buffet, which we did. The eggs were over cooked and the crepes rubbery. Now the major but...during the middle of the night the fire alarm went off. It took more than 5 minutes for us to contact the front desk to find out that there was a malfunction in the system. The hotel had no plan for contacting it's guests in this type of situation to let them know what was happening. All of the staff was very pleasant, the location wonderful, but with all the "buts" I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwl23
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival to the last day, we were met with the kindest most hospitable friendly employees. Stayed in room 503 (topmost level) with a breathtaking double window view overlooking the port. The day views are beautiful, and the nights (with lights reflecting on waters...nothing short of spectacular. The room was absolutely comfortable, large bed, bureau with TV, mini-bar, refrigerator, desk, night stands, CD player, bathroom with multiple jet shower heads, wood floors and brick interior walls. A very "old world" flavor. It was quiet and well attended with maid service daily. They serve a complimentary morning breakfast in their downstairs restaurant (very good selections of french toast, eggs, crepes, meats and cereals of your choice as well as juices and coffee/tea. Suggest you eat THERE instead of trying to find breakfast locally (most do not open until 11am) Location was superb....located directly behind the hotel, a pedestrian street filled with shops, restaurants, pubs and entertainment. One block away fro Place Jacques-Cartier, a wide pedestrian only public square with many more restaurants, shops and street vendors/entertainment. ALL within easy walking distance. Walk down the side streets to find more shops or venture across Rue La Commune to the port piers with shops, cinema and even a small lagoon for paddle boats...or rent a bicycle at one of THOUSANDS locked and rented by credit card ($5.00 per hour) Get a good map of the area and you can walk anywhere down cobbled stone streets, to museums or churches (beautiful), parks, squares or even try your hand at the METRO (if you ride more than ONCE...buy a 1-3 day ticket) it is good for as MANY trips on metro and bus line as you would possibly need and saves money. The hotel staff can guide you to any and all mentioned above. You will not be disappointed with this hotel and location. You definitely get what you pay for....keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: peterVK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. There was a problem with the room key system throughout the hotel, only the master key to all rooms worked....and I must commend the staff....they were very, very friendly and without any sign of being upset or stressed out, went up to the rooms with the patrons to open the rooms. Very nice room, with hardwood floor, overlooking the water. Great location for visiting old Montreal, right in the middle of all the action. Great to be able to open the windows, and experience the city. Bike rental almost next door. We left for the day, and checked out. We told them we would be back around 3 to pick up our car from valet. The staff suggested to simply leave our luggage in our room. When we came back early, around 2 pm, our car was parked out front, ready to go with all luggage in the trunk....now that's service! Oh yeah, and a very nice a la carte breakfast was included...kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and exceptionally friendly service”
Reviews.Author: cumulus96
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this characterful and friendly hotel. The location is wonderful and within easy walking distance of the old town and interesting riverside area. There are lots of good restaurants and bars nearby - difficult to know which way to stroll. Our comfortable and well appointed room was in the main building with large windows onto the front and, although there was some noise from the street and construction, it was a small price to pay for the brilliant location. All the staff were exceptionally cheerful, friendly and helpful - we particularly remember the door staff and our help from reception, especially hunting out gluten free bread at short notice. They made us feel very welcome and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - would definitely go back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosemarie52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Auberge du Vieux -Port on our vacation and loved the hotel and it's service. The hotel is situated in Old Montreal and conveniently located to get around. The room was very well comfortable with all the needed ammenities. It was clean and very well maintained. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and made our stay very pleasant and enjoyable. The breakfast which was included - was great and there was a lovely rooftop terrace for cocktails. We had dinner in the restaurant and enjoyed our meal and service. We would definitely recommend staying a the hotel and would stay there again ourselves. - Rosemarie

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Zuzanecka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Auberge du Vieux-Port for 3 nights during our 2 week Canadian honeymoon. Simply stated, this place was amazing. We splurged for a Deluxe Queen Room... it was gorgeous and impecably clean. Our room had a port view which was beautiful and the only noise I heard from the street below was the clop clop of horses and carriages. The breakfast that was included was absolutely delicious...everything from omlettes, to crepes, or just fruit. Whatever you're in the mood for, they'll make it for you. Right in the heart of Old Montreal, you're within walking distance to all the charms of the old world. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back - LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: PPmgk
Reviews.Content: LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! ...this is the best spot in a beautiful locations surrounded by fun restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. Besides that, the staff was amazing. Super friendly. The girl that checked us in - Milen (I hope I spelled her name right) was beyond helpful. Gave us great recommendations, made reservations and put us on couple of VIP lists. The room was huge and gorgeous - old style but really comfortable with a modern bathroom. Can't say enough how great this hotel was and how friendly and helpful were people that worked there. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: KathyP_11
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant experience at this hotel. The first room we were given faced St. Paul St. so we asked for another room facing the St. Lawrence River. We were upgraded to this room at no additional cost. The room was spacious, the bathroom spotless. The staff was wonderful. Michael at the desk was the best! So accomodating and helpful to make your visit to Montreal a great experience. Delicious breakfast included. Great location for walking about Old Montreal. The only complaint is that they are rennovating the hotel, adding more rooms so there were a lot of workmen around and it was difficult to get the elevatyor. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great service”
Reviews.Author: wmitch6
Reviews.Content: We booked a riverview room for two nights stay. The room was large, well appointed and the king sized bed was very comfortable. It was spotless clean. The bath had been recently renovated and was furnished with a 2 person bubbler style tub and a large walk in shower with rain shower, hand held and body sprays. Very nice. Every single person on the staff that we came in contact with was cheerful, welcoming and helpful. Hi speed WiFi is available with a password from the desk. Parking is by valet although if you know the area there are lots nearby. In my opinion every review should include the negatives, no matter how nit picky, as a heads up to anyone considering booking a room. My biggest complaint is that the weather was so great that we opted to sleep with the windows open. Traffic noise was minimal until about 4 AM when a very noisy train decided to stop in front of the hotel to couple and uncouple cars for about a half hour. Promptly at 6:30 AM workmen showed up at the building next door and started work. That included a really annoying warning beeper on the lift they were using to load materials into the building. The good thing is, the building is an expansion to the Auberge and is scheduled for completion within a week. The train (didn't happen the second night) and the construction work are the reason I downgraded the sleep quality. I don't know how regular the train disturbance is, but the construction was temporary.

Reviews.Title: “There was nothing that would improve this experience except maybe doing it again”
Reviews.Author: vinniel
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a valet who took our bags and ushered us into the reception area. The receptionist was very friendly, got us checked in and suggested we return when we were ready to plan our trip. We were taken to a quaint, romantic, charming and comfortable room overlooking the main street and the river beyond it. The room was large and airy with great windows that opened and allowed great views. A great bathroom with plenty of towels and a nice shower. The concierge was so helpful in showing us some great local things to do and the best way to get around, they also made reservations to two great restaurants. Overall our stay was wonderful with nothing that would improve it except to repeat it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: uk2England
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more helpful. As soon as we pulled up in our Taxi from the airpot. Which we were advised correctly by the hotel was a set fee ($38.00 at our time of travel) We were greeted by the porter who loaded all our luggage including skiâ€™s onto his trolley. We were registed by Michael the concierge. He was very informative and friendly. Telling us about the hotel and its Restaurant facility. Also booking us onto a Bus Tour the next day and booking us a table at a Jazz Club both of which we can recommend. The hotel room was just as described with all the little luxuries not often found in hotels. The bed was one of the best we have ever slept in and the Jacuzzi bath was always welcome. Breakfast was freshly cooked setting us up for the day . We tried local restaurant all of which were excellent and accommodating. On a negative note we had a couple of problems which were soon rectified to our satisfaction by the hotel manager Eric Therrien. Who took the trouble to speak to us personally. Thank you and thank you to Michael who passed on our concerns to him. I would return to this hotel on my next visit to Montreal and have already recommended to family and friends. Thanks to the Auberge for a great relaxing start to our holiday in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again and again...”
Reviews.Author: coronationcats20
Reviews.Content: Lots of competiton out there! I've been to MOntreal close to 20 times and this hotel, which we only discovered our last trip in November, is by far the best in MOntreal. The location is perfect...close to lots of shops, galleries and restaurants...with a perfect view of the harbour. Breakfast, which was included, was excellent. Top notch service at the desk. I think the best service I've ever received actually. Best of all, spacious room with lots of character AND the most comfortable bed. I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. I truly can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: JMG83
Reviews.Content: I went there for holidays without knowing what it would be. I have stayed in the Loft, and honestly, it was really amazing!!! The hotel is very well located, the room is excellent, really well furnished, the room is really big, the bathroom really clean, and the best of all is the service. It is more then excellent, the people are really nice, always helpful and smiling which make your stay really great. I strongly recommend this hotel if you want to go and feel yourself at home and sometime even better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - amazing breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller097
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon in December - room was great - huge size, and fantastic view over the port. Despite the freezing temperatures of Montreal winter, it was always warm inside the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts included in the room price were just amazing. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant at night, but the breakfast waiting staff gave fantastic service, we were very impressed. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from a metro stop, but it was part of the attraction of the place to be in the old town and not right in the bustle of the city. Decor was slightly rustic but still pretty smart - felt a lot more comfortable than in one of the ultrachic boutique hotels that are very close by. Expect that it is very different in summer - being in winter meant it was pretty quiet, and no problem getting a table in restaurants/looking around the tourist areas. Loads of places to eat within a few minutes walk - Les 3 Brasseurs particularly good pub and the SteakHouse Vieux Port was also good. Great start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: jaxusc
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed here for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. We had the room overlooking the street with two very comfortable double beds. The only thing the room was missing was a fireplace. Breakfast was good, eggs/pastries or crepes. The crepes were dry and over cooked but the omelets were always perfect. We had our welcome drink after we checked in and stayed for dinner. Food was good. We felt taken care of very well by the front desk and our room as well as the hotel was a breath of fresh air compared to the big chain hotels we could have stayed at. This hotel has character ! Would come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Cute but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Silva
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotel.ca, and after booking, I realized that my room was 500 meters from the hotel???????????? I was concerned but I had an open mind. I checked in, and the folks at the reception were very nice and pleasant. A young man guided me to my room and gave me a brief explanation of the area, restaurants, convenience stores near by, etc... We climbed the infinite stairs that lead to the room, and when I opened the door I was impressed with the room. It was a studio apartment furnished with up to date furniture and decorated with exposed brick walls, and nice hardware. The room was on the top of a restaurant (Modavie), and although they have small music bands downstairs, I did not hear a thing from them. Unfortunately, I could not say the same about my room neighbors. I guess my bed and their bed was separated by a wall, and I as they decided to have sex for hours with small breaks until 1:00a.m., that was when I was able to sleep. I suffered with the couple for two nights. I don't know how the rooms that are inside of the Auberge were (noise wise), but I would not come back. There was not house keeping in the room during my 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilarPortElizabeth
Reviews.Content: A charming, well run, good value for money hotel in an excellent location. The staff, without exception, were extremely helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. We were upgraded to a King room overlooking the port, which was lovely; exposed stone walls and beautiful wooden floors. The only thing missing was a kettle and a tea tray - my only criticism. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Poppysmart
Reviews.Content: Disembarked from cruise at Port Montreal and we walked from the ship to the hotel, the walk took about 20 minutes over flat terrain dragging our bags. We arrived around 8 AM to be greeted by the most personable porter you could hope for. He stopped us at the foot of say four stairs and he hauled our considerable luggage into the reception area, we offered to help, no, you have done enough. The receptionist was lovely, took our phone number and rang us when our room was ready. Our bags were waiting in our room for us, two flights of stairs up. The staff also collected our bags and took them to reception for a very early departure five days later. We stayed in a self contained loft a short distance from the main office, we wanted for nothing, the room was spotless, very large and we had 3 local friends visit us, they were very impressed. The location was literally in the heart of Old Montreal, a great spot, we walked everywhere, restaurants on our door step and a convenience store across the way. Helen Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay for good value”
Reviews.Author: Googlehead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge for 2 nights this October. For $199 a night we were treated to a welcome drink, a giant room, delicious breakfasts and helpful, courteous staff. There were always smiles for us and a willingness to help us with any questions we may have. We booked online direct and had a confirmation email 3 days prior to our arrival. A few practical notes: part of the charm and appeal of the area are the restaurants and bars as well as the historic building. As such, you will hear street noise in the room. If you are a light sleeper, you may want earplugs and request to stay facing rue de la Commune. We faced St Paul and did have some late night noise, but nothing particularly intrusive. Were this June or July, I'm sure that noise would be more obvious. While there may be a party outside, there isn't one inside. At 11:15 on a Saturday the bar was closed. The restaurant and bar were busy around 7, but everything was shuttered relatively early. Our room had a great jacuzzi with separate shower. The shower stall, however, was a bit tight. Strange, given the enormous size of the room, so hopefully any future updates will include a larger shower (walk-in would be great!). Television choices are limited (though that's not what we were there for). Bed was a bit of a marshmallow - pillowtop and mattress pad made for something of a soft sleep. If you like a firm mattress, this is not your place. I would definitely return to the auberge. While there may be some things I would change were I to have a magic wand, they are minor.

Reviews.Title: “Having an argument that ruins your trip...priceless!”
Reviews.Author: happigolucky
Reviews.Content: if you want to ruin any chance of a holiday or vacation and have access to a totally bad attitude from rude unhelpful hotel staff or are in the mood for an argument about everything under the sun and noisy sleepless room with no amenities that are promised this is your perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Auberge is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dawnlpm
Reviews.Content: NOTE - This review is from a stay 2 years ago in September We stayed at Auberge du Vieux-Port in the room on their website, postcard and framed in the elevator (I believe floor 2)....King bed, brick walls, on the water. From the moment we checked in we were treated very well. No matter who was at the desk, they were always friendly and gave us great advise of places to go for food, drinks, activities, etc. The breakfast included in the morning is in the basement as has so much character to it.
