The waitresses were always nice and they even gave us tips on places to go around town. You can choose from an actual menu that has a good variety of food as opposed to most places that just have a continental breakfast. One night I had gotten a tattoo and some of the ink got on the sheets....I told the cleaning staff and they were very nice about it which I was a little nervous about! Ha The area right around the corner has a ton of fantastic restaurants, bars and even horse carriage rides if you like that kind of thing. We loved everything about this charming and quaint hotel and all of the people that work there! The only 2 negatives are that the roof bar was not open when we were there and we would have loved to go up there for drinks as the view is spectacular. Also - there is a bit of street noise but nothing that bothered us or kept us awake by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: peggys_antiques
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a real gem right on the waterfront of Montreal's old port. Room was beautifully decorated to capture the charm of the old building with all the comforts you could ask for. Everyone in the hotel staff we had contact with was incredibly helpful and courteous. Restaurant recommendations were honest and spot on. The first night we wanted to stay close to the hotel for dinner at a BYOB place. The hotel concierge told us there are only two restaurants in the old city that are BYOB and told us the downfalls of both. Alas, I was tired and we picked one knowing it wouldn't be great. It wasn't, but we had been warned. We really enjoyed our two night stay and recommend it highly although be warned that the website is not real clear that the lofts are not in the same building as the hotel and the loft buildings have no elevator. I didn't find this out until I'd booked a reservation online for a loft, but a quick phone call was all it took to transfer our reservation to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 2ozzietravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had a wonderful stay. I had booked a certain room many months prior to our stay and when we arrived that room was ours. It was on the top floor. The staff, special mention to Amelie, Michael and the ever helpful Fred, were remarkable. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they made us feel welcome immediately. All were so friendly we were taken a little aback as this is not always the case. The hotel is in fact a very old building which has been restored and refurbished to a very high standard. Our room had a king size bed which was one of the best we had ever slept on. If we could have fitted it in our luggage it would have been gone. We had two windows which opened on to a view of the marina and old port. We would lean out the windows of an evening and have a scotch whilst watching the hansom carriages clip clop past and the walkers and cyclists pass by. The sunrises we saw from these windows were exceptional. Some of the most colorful we have ever seen, (see attached photos). The room was tastefully decorated. The walls were what appeared to be original old brick, very cosy looking. The floors were timber, so we made sure we took off our hard soled shoes at night so the guests below us would not be disturbed. The restaurant on the ground floor was exceptional. We had a wonderful meal there one night. We would have had more but there were too many other restaurants around us to try. The complimentary breakfast was served on the lower ground floor and was all one could ask for. Both the restaurant and breakfast area were very well decorated, comfortable and of a very high standard. It was only a short walk to a nice plaza and many other restaurants. A walk to the center of the Montreal business and shopping area took us no more than twenty minutes at a reasonable walking pace and there was lots to see on the way. When we remember this hotel the first thing that springs to mind was the wonderful, friendly staff. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, fabulous inn in the heart of old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: liz5111
Reviews.Content: We were charmed by our stay at L'Auberge du Vieux-Port. While it is a very old building on the banks of the St. Lawrence River in the old restored section of Montreal, there's nothing antique about the inside. Our room featured exposed brick walls, wood floors, floor-ceiling windows (that swung open!) and marble bath w/ a full tub. It was just lovely, esp. because we chose a room that overlooked the river (a wise choice -- it's quieter than the back side of the hotel). The front desk, bellboys and wait staff were fabulous -- they couldn't do enough to please us. My husband and I would absolutely return to this lovely little inn. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, the location, the restaurant and the staff!”
Reviews.Author: GabbaGabba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. From the minute we arrived to the hotel, we had top notch service. We were made to feel welcome and they showed us that they appreciated our business. Upon arrival, the gentleman at the front desk asked us if we had any plans. After we explained what we hoped to see and do, he gave us maps and helped us plan our stay so that we'd be able to accomplish all that we had on our agenda. He even gave us a few extra ideas just in case we had some time left over. He gave us tips on how to navigate the area, restaurant suggestions, shopping suggestions and the list goes on. He even offered to make any reservations we may need during our stay. The breakfast was included with the rate of the hotel and let me tell you, it was awesome. There is a cold buffet stocked with breads, fruits and juices which you help yourself to and if you want to, you may also order a hot cooked meal, a la cart. We had just about everything because we were there for 3 mornings and my advice to diners, would be to bring your appetite. The food was delicious! There is a computer (with printer) in the main lobby for guests to use. I used it to check my email, tripadvisor for more ideas while in town, and to check-in for our flight home. This is a real bonus for keeping in touch with family while you're away too. This way they will know that you arrived safe, are having a great time etc... Or if you're waiting for your spouse (lol) you can kill time checking our the internet, or facebook yadda, yadda. Our room was on the fifth floor (top) and faced the waterfront area. Terrific view day and night (he boats and shops are all lit up in the evening). I liked to leave our window open even on a cool day because I loved the sound of the horses walking on the cobble stone roads. The toiletries supplied in the bathroom were from a local spa and were a nice treat to use. House keeping does a great job tidying up and were very pleasant. We bumped into them in the room once, and in the elevator a few times. They always smile and say bonjour... Check out was a breeze. Quick and no surprises. They asked us if we needed a taxi and when we said that we were going to walk to the 747 airport shuttle, they gave us a map and perfect instructions. Can't wait to go back and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: bb1120
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Old Montreal at Auberge du Vieux Port and loved it! Everyone in the staff- valet, front desk and restaurant staff- were all friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable - not high end luxury but very nice. Our room looked out over St. Paul Street and we liked sitting at the open window and watching the activity below... especially loved listening to the music during the day. We were worried that there might be too much noise at night, but once we closed the windows the room was very soundproof... having said that, we weren't there on a weekend night, which could possibly be different? The breakfast that is included in the price is a nice bonus. Be sure to check out the roof top terrace, although I wish they could do some soundproofing with the a/c units up there. I had a great, simple lunch on the roof top one afternoon - the choices are limited but it was very good. When booking my reservation I asked if they had any special fares and they gave me the third night at half price so if you are staying more than two nights be sure to ask for that. We loved the location and would stay there again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: bklyn1056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from trip to Montreal and Quebec City and stayed at Vieux-Port for 2 days. What a wonderful place! Decor was beautiful. Loved the bed, very comfortable. The room was spotless. Friendly and helpful staff! Great location- right across from the water. We wouldn't change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Stonewell
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights spent at the Auberge du Vieux Port. Our spacious room overlooking the port had the charm of times gone by with the wooden beams and exposed stone walls but was modern enough to please those who prefer a standard hotel. Breakfast is delicious with ample choices. The staff is amazing-one of the best I have ever encountered at a hotel. There was nothing they couldn't do and always with a smile. Emily, Mylene, and Fred the bellhop made us feel right at home. I look forward to returning next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot, may never try another Montreal Hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Jbink
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Spot right in the heart of Old Montreal. Our elegant room had a lovely view of St. Paul Street that made you imagine the history of times past. The room was well kept, and well equipped with everything you could possibly need. The old wooden columns and stone/brick walls evoked a mood created nowhere else. The location is perfect for a romantic Old Montreal getaway, surrounded by exciting things to do and see. The staff is friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The breakfast was excellent. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel with Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: LBloomberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Auberge at the end of April. The hotel is located on the port in the middle of Old Montreal. Everything from the lobby to the breakfast room to the guest room was gorgeously decorated and immaculate. The staff was incredible, parking our car for us and fetching a bag that was left in the backseat, even though the car was parked 10 minutes away. They also changed some money from USD to Canadian Dollars for us. The room was beautiful with a comfortable king-size bed and huge shower. Our only complaint was the noise coming from the old port. There seemed to be some sort of construction going on which continued well into the night and early the next morning. Auberge du Vieux-Port may not seem like a good value, but it is. Montreal is an expensive city to stay in, and there are plenty more hotels for the same price with much less charm and personality. It was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, friendly, pretty, heart of Vieux-Port”
Reviews.Author: CAinNJ
Reviews.Content: There is a warmth from all employees as soon as you step foot in the hotel. All the staff give the impression they love working at the auberge Vieux-Port and are enthusiastic in helping you in anyway they can. Chief concierge Michael,thanks for getting us Cirque du soliel tickets, Mathieu who helped us with our bags, Jen, in the roof top terrace to name a few, were helpful, very friendly and a pleasure to converse with. Wish i knew other names as all were outstanding. Room was lovely and bright with wood beams, comfy bed, crisp white bedding and fluffy white towels. Separate large jucuzzi tub and shower. nice smelling bath products. Overlooked Rue Ste Paul. felt like we were in heart of old town. Yes there were tourists, but better described as well behaved travelers.Great location. Would stay there again and again, even though a little pricey. Taxi to airport $38 (staff will make sure you are not ripped off) We got the new bus shuttle from airport, $7 and you can ride the subway for the rest of the day Got off at St Laurent and walked down. a bit of construction, but ok if you have packed light. I stay in hotels all around the world about 5 times a month. This hotel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bagicatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. The room was large and well furnished as was the bathroom - ideal for relaxing after traipsing round the town. The staff were generally friendly and helpful but I would expect a little more professionalism in the restaurant area. The only down sides are the public areas don't really feel comfortable and the room service didn't replenish the coffee, etc. Restaurant and location are also good. It is not cheap but overall good value

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Traveler9028
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in one of the suites at Auberge du Vieux-Ports in Feb. Weather was bitterly cold but we did not care as the suite was perfect. From the moment we arrived and the valet took care of our bags and our car, we felt pampered and well taken care of. The accomodations were comfortable and homey and although the street below was noisy (late night revelers) our overall stay was very pleasant. We did not mind the short two flights of stairs to get to the room. The location of the suite (diagonally across the street from the main hotel) made us feel like we had our own apartment in the old city. The staff was very helpful and the overall experience could not have been more positive.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top hotels- ever”
Reviews.Author: sarahantin
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. We were welcomed warmly and instantly and upgraded to a bigger room without asking. Our room was lovely- with a brick wall, high ceilings and a jacuzzi bath. The products in the bathroom were wonderful and everything was clean. We received free internet (something that we didn't get a few days later at the much more expensive Westin in Mont Tremblant) and a great free breakfast. The location was great, too- overlooking the water and close to everything. Every single person at the hotel was kind and helpful. I would never stay in another hotel in Montreal. This is probably one of the best all around hotels that I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thearrogantchef
Reviews.Content: L' Auberge is a very nice hotel in the heart of Old Montreal. The staff makes you feel at home and goes out of its way to help you with everything from getting settled in to finding good restaurants. They even took care of making reservations for us for our two night stay. We did encounter a slight plumbing problem but within an hour the plumber arrived and the problem was fixed. The beds are extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. I will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Old Port”
Reviews.Author: megv21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auberge for 3 nights in November. It was a great experience from start to finish. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was sufficient enough to get us started for the day. We were in a room on the 5th floor, the room was great. The only comments are that the in room "jacuzzi" was not much more than a small bath (but the shower is fine!). It was a great base for our stay in Montreal. The Old Port can be a bit touristy, but it's easy enough to find good restaurants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed this jaded traveler”
Reviews.Author: TicketFromMe
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, it's fun to stay in a non-big-chain hotel, when it works out. This time it did, and I'm glad. Montreal is so different from any other North American city I know, so I wanted us to stay somewhere that would remind us we weren't in Kansas. This place does the trick. It has an historic feel throughout, displaying many interesting relics from its past, some with narrative plaques. It's very intimate and cozy. There's one main inn, plus some lofts over a nice bar, where my friends stayed, just a city block away. My room was very spacious and clean, which can also be said of my friends' loft. Their loft could have slept 6 -- it had one bedroom, plus a sleeping area a few feet above a living room with a sofabed (I think). I could easily have crashed with them, except the loft/living room sleeping areas offered little privacy. You can see what the rooms look like from others' photos. I'll just add that mine was very clean, comfortable and quaint, if not ultra luxurious. It was a little too dark at night -- higher wattage bulbs, or at least a proper reading lamp would be a nice place to start, people. But my stay was relaxing, and the staff were ALL very friendly and polite and helpful to me. Hotels with character and charm typically have trade-offs. No A/C in the summer (if true) could be a problem. The front entrance is an awkward 3 stairs above the sidewalk. If Canada's accessibility laws are anything like ours, I assume they can accommodate wheels in the back entrance, which is on the charmingly cobblestoned and slightly touristy Rue St. Paul. By the way, the noise complaints are right. They should rename the above street Rue Bourbon; it is crunking loud, even on a cold November weeknight. The windows of this old hotel can keep out the weather, but not the shouting and singing. Easy solution: Request a room over the front of the building (port view), which will be much quieter. Not an option for me, because there happened to be renovation work on that side, but the ear plugs I remembered in my travel kit were enough to get me back to sleep. Nighttime revelers aside, we enjoyed the location. Chinatown restaurants and The Champ-de-Mars Metro station are just a 5-minute walk, although not in inclement weather. But Montreal is a proper city, with cabs (and rent-a-bikes, it would seem) on practically every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in downtown Montreal, but thought I would try the Old Port area for variety's sake and chose Auberge du Vieux-Port because it seemed like a nice place and good value. I selected a 'deluxe loft' suite which is not located in the main building, it was roughly a five minute walk from the hotel itself. What seemed chic and charming on their website was much less so in reality. The building itself was a beautiful old stone building, which was great looking on the outside. On the inside, access to the suite was only via a staircase - three flights up. There is no elevator, so be forewarned if you have a lot of bags, heavy bags, or have difficulty walking. The hallway to the suite itself also serves other suites that do not house hotel guests. I heard families coming and going and screaming in the halls at odd hours. The suite itself is large, has decent but not great furnishings and the condition was well below expectation. Maintenance was poor, and there was evidence of shoddy construction and upkeep. Walls are also quite thin, and because the sleeping portion of the loft itself hangs over the hallway, it was quite easy to hear everybody coming and going. Another problem is the design of the unit itself. Specifically the bathroom is on the main level and with the sleeping loft upstairs if you have to use the bathroom at night you must navigate a staircase in the dark. Very dangerous, in my opinion. Another problem related to temperature control in the suite. In short, there is no ability to control the temperature. There is a thermostat, but it is turned off and according to the hotel the temperature is regulated at the 'building' level, not the individual suite level. It happened to be quite warm, and because the windows were inoperable there was no way to cool it off. Also problematic is a huge industrial air duct located directly over the bed which is loud, cannot be shut off, blowing warm air 24/7. This is so loud it was literally impossible to sleep. When combined with the warm temperature in the suite itself it created a situation where I walked over to the main building at 2:30am and asked the hotel management if I could change rooms. Management was very accommodating, and at 3am I left the suite with my bags for a regular room in the main building. This regular room was much better, and consistent with what I expected. In summary, I would avoid the high priced suites and stay in the main building. But after this experience I'm not sure I would return. Also the internet connection in the room was unreliable and service was spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: janester75
Reviews.Content: I visited Montreal for five days for business and stayed in one of the lofts on Rue St Paul. It was a fantastic location, above a nice bar/restaurant on a picturesque street. The hotel staff were friendly and helped in every possible way, including getting my colleague and I tickets to the sold out ice hockey match. The breakfast, while an additional charge, was incredibly reasonably priced ($10) and plentiful (which helps when nothing is open before 11am!!). As part of my stay I used the gym facilities at one of the nearby sister hotels which is one of the great benefits of the lofts; it feels like an apartment but you can use all of the facilities at any of their hotels. I got a great deal; had a great time and would stay there again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: firebugs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 201 for 3 nights for our honeymoon. The auberge is located in the old city, not far from the train station (where we arrived in Montreal). We were greeted very warmly both by the desk attendant and the doorman. We were able to check in easily and the doorman helped us with our luggage to our room. The room is absolutely beautiful. Exposed rock walls and wooden beams, two enormous windows that looked out onto a park and the St.Lawrence river (we were told this is the only hotel to offer such a view). Really, it was everything the pictures promised. There was a large mini-bar available and robes and slippers as well. From 5-7pm they offer free wine and cheese to guests, which we took advantage of each day. The bar/restaurant was outfitted in dark wood and dark walls which set a nice mood. And the breakfast! Guests are led to the basement, again with exposed rock walls, and treated to a continental and hot breakfast. We munched on croissants and chocolate muffins and fruit until our crepes or eggs arrived. We were blown away by the generous meal and the staff were very friendly, being polite when we tried our bad French with them. The auberge is close to museums, restaurants and an art market. I don't think I have anything negative to say about the hotel or our experience. I gave the room 4/5 only because I wished it had a bathtub instead of just a shower. Even the toiletries were great (provided by a spa that the hotel also owns). We definitely plan to go back to Montreal and stay at this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “"Old World" Without the Charm”
Reviews.Author: Toronto21
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful, friendly and accommodating. That out of the way, let's be clear that the lofts (ours was #704) are not charming. They are old, dated, and in buildings that lack maintenance and upkeep. A leather couch, hardwood floors, nice potted plants and retro paintings on the walls cannot hide the ceramic tiles falling of the bathroom wall, cracked counters, and a toilet that continuously runs (to mention only a few things). Add to this, hearing a dog bark all day and night, loud footsteps above your head, partying in the streets below to all hours, and constant garbage trucks, street cleaners...and you get the picture that this may not be the place for romantic, charming, quiet night(s) you were looking for. Of course, if you are young at heart and love staying over at a frat house, then you might enjoy the #704 loft. We will not return. Paying what we did for 1 hour of uninterrupted sleep was abit too steep!

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: joandgr
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in Old Montreal.Room was excellent,breakfast very good and very good service from all staff. Free Internet access.Valet parking a bit pricey but worth it as no parking is available near the hotel.Near to lots of excellent if touristy restaurants. Pity about the rain which spoiled our stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “All I hoped for and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: perodie
Reviews.Content: A great get away for my husband and I as a reward for the close of a huge project at work. Beautiful setting, walking distance to all of old town Montreal and Metro for going farther out. The staff was great, they went out of their way to make our stay perfect. Having a great breakfast every morning made it even more relaxing, giving you time to plan the day. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beefie82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the lofts (713 - luxury loft) for 4 nights. It was the best accomdation ever! The room was beautiful and romantic. The best part of the hotel was the breakfast in the morning. It was definately worth getting up in the morning (those that stayed in the lofts will need to pay 10 dollars for breakfast.....included if you stay in the hotel) the 10 dollars was definately worth it! Julie and Michael (conceirge) were excellent! Every morning we would ask them to help us plan our day.....the know where the local hang outs are.......we even asked them to help us call to reserve a table for two at a restaurant that needs days in advance for reservations (au pied du cochon).....they were able to get us a table for two to celebrate our anniversary. excellent service.......just a reminder the hotel lofts do not have elevators so be okay with the fact that after a day of sightseeing you'll have to climb up the stairs. Overall a great experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: scottme
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in one of the loft apartments (601); a huge space, very well equipped, so no complaints about the accommodation. However the occupiers of the apartment above us arrived at about 1:30am and seemed to be havng a loud party with dancing until about 3:30am. Despite that, I'd stay there again. Service was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Kenthurstian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great 'french' experience in the old part of Montreal. The location, the building, the staff, the restaturants, the roof top terrace for cocktails or lunch, the main restaurant, the basement restaurant and the rooms are all very reminiscent of a harbourfront type hotel in France. There are some quaint aspects that make the hotel a little quirky (the early morning trains going past to the docks, the early morning trash collection, my rental car beng double parked for 20 minutes in a busy traffic lane before being parked by the valet). However, those things are all part of the experience - and we loved it. I even got a chance to use my high school french to the amusement of the staff and to my surprise as to how much I could remember. All in all a great little hotel, in a very good location away from central Montreal. Loved it and would return any time that I am in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, jazz, food”
Reviews.Author: ptdbfla
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and bed very comfortable, bathroom had jacuzzi. Room was not what I expected however. I expected a view of the Port and had requested a room high up (5th floor is highest floor). I was put on the 1st floor, commented to bellman about that, he said probably due to my "special rate. However even on the 5th floor I don't think you will see the water due to tall trees blocking all views except from rooftop restaurant. My windows were supposed to open but did not and they were filthy. If I could have opened them, I'd have cleaned them myself! There is a train track just across the street on the tree lined median and a long freight train comes through at 4 and 6 a.m. However I'm a pretty good sleeper and it did not bother me too much. The area is delightful but very touristy...but I'm a tourist so enjoyed it all. Many many restaurants available, the restaurant and lounge in the hotel has good food also. A great jazz duo guitar and bass play from 6-9 Thur Fri and Sat...and there is a complementary glass of wne and cheese every evening for guests. Entry to the hotel is up 4 steps and no ramp for anyone with a disability. I arrived at 8 p.m. and my cab driver dragged my suitcase up the steps into lobby where check-in was easy and Matthew took me to my room. He and all other hotel personnel are extremely helpful...they will make arrangements for an on/off bus tour and will arrange for you to be picked up by the tour company at the hotel. I highly recommend the hotel in many ways, wish I could have been higher up since being on the first floor I could hear delivery trucks in the early morning plus heavy rock music from the bar next door until 3 a.m., after which some drunks argued or laughed loud enough that I could hear them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: 1066girl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was the best hotel we stayed in on our trip to Canada. We were helped in with our bags as soon as we got to the door and greeted by friendly staff at the desk to check in. We got there on Saturday night so we thought it could be noisy due to surrounding bars and with us staying on the 2nd floor but it was fine. The room was very cosy, spacious and very tastefully decorated. The only criticism I could possibly make was there were little house spiders everywhere! The breakfast was amazing, though the first morning (it being a Sunday) I don't think they were prepared for us appearing so early! Still, there was so much choice with a buffet and a menu to choose from and it was all really tasty. We also got wine and cheese every evening, shame we could only make it for the two evenings of the four as it was nice. Also, they had a computer we could use for free in the lobby and could print out for free which is a good service to be able to use. The location was very good, ok it is a busy area, but it was so convenient for getting to all the places we wanted and was very safe to walk around at night. Overall, a really good place to stay and we left happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: D-co
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel -- it's exactly the kind I like: small with big rooms and a great service staff in a wonderful location. Our room faced the river and was perfect. The concierge helped us out with all our restaurant reservations and suggested some fine places we hadn't thought of. We only had two problems: the wi-fi didn't work in the room... and we came in on a Saturday night -- and on Saturday nights in summer it's fireworks night in Montreal, so hundreds of thousands of people are headed to the Vieux-Port area... took us hours to get to the hotel. So if you're flying in, don't come in late on Saturday! But that's not the hotel's fault -- it was a lovely place. Also liked the restaurant, Narcisse Bistro, that's there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Never have I been so glad to leave a place.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMary
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Loft Apartments at Auberge du Vieux-Port was supposed to be the highlight of our trip, especially as it was the most expensive place we were staying in during our holiday, unfortunately our whole experience left a bitter taste in our mouths and we couldn't leave fast enough. In fairness check in was fine, but we were disappointed on arrival in our apartment to find that there wasn't sufficient crockery for our party and the pots and pans were locked in a cupboard we didn't have a key to access. We had asked for an apartment with a king and two doubles, which we were told by the concierge was what we had been given, but on arrival at the apartment in reality we had two kings and a sofa bed. Eventually a couple of hours after check in when the crockery etc had been unlocked and we had eaten, we settled down to watch TV and log onto the internet, except we couldn't, for various reasons to numerous to go into we didn't get the internet as promised many times by the concierge at all during our stay. Additionally we had a young family staying above us with a love of loud music, not only did we have to endure their music, but their children running around above us loudly until late at night, so if you value a good nights sleep look elsewhere. Needless to say by the time we checked out the concierge was neither as friendly nor as welcoming as on arrival, never have I been so glad to leave a place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of OBNOXIOUS LOUD club next door!”
Reviews.Author: amykatefoster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a 2 night romantic stay at this hotel. The valet parking made an easy check in...it was nuts at that time of day, i think it was around 2pm on a friday. Upon entering our lovely room, we noticed the bed was kind of leaning funny, it was broken and wobbily. Oh well, it's so beautiful, I am not going to worry about that. We could hear a violinist playing "La Vie en Rose" outside our window....a fave song from our recent wedding...ahh... Then I took a soak in the LARGE whirlpool tub! Yay!!!...hey, only 2 of the jets 'sort of' work...oh well....we are having fun, so it didn't matter. After wandering the t-shirt packed over touristy area of Vieux Montreal, we had a lovely dinner at Narcisse in the hotel. Lovely meal, lovely service, thank you Charles! We returned to our room. The violinist STILL playing (about 6pm) the same La Vie en Rose/Memories/Twinkle Twinkle Little Star montage.....(that's all he knew). HE PLAYED NON STOP UNTIL ALMOST MIDNIGHT RIGHT OUTSIDE OUR WINDOW!!! (We were on the noisier Rue St. Paul side)..oh, it gets noisier. There was a club next door that started getting hopping around midnight. Who goes to these clubs? Drunken teenagers!!! All hanging outside on the street carrying on for hours. Needless to say, I called the desk and they offered to move us up to the 5th (from the 2nd) flr, same side. I said no thanks. 30 ft of vertical change wasn't going to cut it. We left in the morning and went to Burlington VT instead. The next morning, the desk staff said 'don't stay here on a weekend in the summer' thanks for the heads up....never again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and big space”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: In April 2009, my friends and I decided to take a trip to Montreal. After much research, we decided to stay at Auberge du Vieux-Port. We had 4 girls in total and it was more than enough room. We stayed in the superier room with 2 Queen size beds. The place was great because we had a kitchen, dining room and big living room. The only downside was that it only had 1 washroom, but we managed. I love the brick walls and amount of space it provided us 4 girls. Love the location! When you exit, you exit right out to the street and are 2 steps away from restaurants and shops. Another thing I didn't like was the fact that this place doesn't have elevators.. it was very hard to pull up suitcases up 3 flights of stairs. Other than that.. I loved it there and would go back. Maybe this time with my husband. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all around - we will be back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: serabebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this terrific hotel for three nights during our honeymoon. The hotel staff was excellent--very kind and incredibly helpful. Our room was beautiful, large, and immaculate -- just like the pictures on the website. (The mattress felt brand new.) Each night we went downstairs to the bar for a complimentary glass of wine and cheese. In the morning we went downstairs for the complimentary breakfast--the french toast was particularly delicious! The hotel offered free wireless in the rooms. Valet parking was pretty much necessary, but was fairly priced. The location was perfect for exploring Old Montreal and it was a reasonable walk to the Jazz Festival downtown. Thank you Michael, Matthew, and Frederick for a perfect honeymoon in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Let's double book our rooms”
Reviews.Author: snikitoronto
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago so I decided to stay at their superior loft this time as well. We get to the hotel and the reception area is crawling with bugs. but to top it off, the concierge lies to us about a maintenance problem that occurred that same day so they couldn't contact us. It turns out there's no maintenance problem, they've double booked the room during the beer festival, and so the people who arrived before us got the room, as though it's first come, first serve. The manager was UNAVAILABLE, and the staff were incredibly RUDE. One staff member actually had the nerve to ask us to keep calm/quiet or they would kick us out and refuse us service. If you ever decide to stay at this hotel, have a back-up ready.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: BeanTownTraveler1018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in May '09. We had a river facing room on the 5th floor - the room was exactly as advertised with hardwood floors, exposed brick, and a modern bathroom. The room was large and comfortable, with a fantastic view of the river/Vieux-Port. We live in the city on a busy street, so minimal street noise doesn't bother us, but it is worth mentioning that on two mornings, a train did pass directly in front of the hotel rather early in the morning and it was fairly loud, even on the 5th floor with the windows closed. Other than the early morning noise, there wasn't one bad thing about the room The hotel has a fantastic restaurant with outdoor, street level seating, but if you go in the late spring/summer, make sure to have drinks at the roof top bar, which has a great view and a relaxing atmosphere. One perk of staying here is the complimentary wine/cheese offered every night in the hotel bar from 5-7pm. On two of the nights we stayed, they also had live jazz music in the bar. As other posters have mentioned, the location is great for visiting all the main sites in Vieux - Montreal and there are an abundance of dining options nearby that meet any price range. If you're looking to be close to the nightlife on Crescent St/St. Catherine's this hotel probably isn't for you, but if you want to stay in a charming hotel, with great service, and a fantastic location in Vieux-Montreal, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!!”
Reviews.Author: browneyedpretty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this particular hotel April 30/09 to May 2/09. We were very pleased with our choice of hotels. The employees are helpful and prompt and made our stay very comfortable. The hotel has that old feel to it that we loved. Everything is in walking distance, the shops, restaurants and Notre Dame Basilica is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for surprise getaway.”
Reviews.Author: MRVdocent
Reviews.Content: I chose the Auberge du Vieux Port based on a friend's recommendation as a surprise getaway for my husband's birthday. It was a perfect choice. We were there 2 nights. The price including dinner and parking was very reasonable. Front desk and parking valet were gracious and accomodating. Wine/cheese offered each evening, along with live jazz on the nights we were there. Many attractions within walking distance. We will return again another time.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Drive my Car Into Garage and they Wil not Reimburce for Work”
Reviews.Author: Scotty1p
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived, the room they had for us was dirty and had not been cleaned by room service yet, so they moved us to a smaller but still a nice room. I figured, this happens, they fixed the problem the best they could. Later that night when we went down stairs for dinner, the manager stopped me and said there was a problem with my car. Told me they would bring it around, which they did 45 minutes later. The hotel had driven my new Lexus into a parking support causing damage to the back left side of the car. Again, I figured this happens and they assured me they would pay for the repairs if I provided them with an estimate. This morning I received a call from them saying they will not be sending me a check to cover the damages. I worked with this hotel chain for 3 months now trying to resolve this problem and there has been no effort on their part to correct it. To be fair, the hotel is beautiful and a short walk to some great spots. However the look of a hotel is nothing com paired to its ability to manage it's services. If you decide to stay here, do not bring your car, do not expect the senior managers to support any additional services or needs you may want and certainly do not trust anything they tell you about rates, refunds or room charges. I would say it was like living in a beautiful condo with a slumlord as a landlord.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EFOttawa
Reviews.Content: We spent a very pleasant weekend at the Auberge de Vieux Port in mid-March. The room was as presented on the website â€“ the stone wall, wooden posts and wooden floors gave it a unique and romantic character that you will not find in your typical high-rise hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the downtown attractions and key buildings. We walked to and from the train station in about thirty minutes, along the way passing Notre Dame and the convention centre. Supper at the hotel restaurant was excellent, and we enjoyed the jazz duo that plays on weekends. There were also several restaurants catering to a range of tastes and prices on St. Paul Street, directly behind the hotel. The price was also as presented, with no surprises at checkout time. The room came with a Jacuzzi tub, but unfortunately it was only built for one. (Well, two people could fit if you are both small.) We prefer a firm mattress, so we found the bed to be very comfortable. The only negative was that noise from the street level easily drifts up and through the window, so be warned if you are prone to retiring early. However, what struck us most was the very attentive service, and the outgoing, enthusiastic and friendly attitude of the hotel staff, making this one of the most pleasant stays at any hotel we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in. Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: lancejackie
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a lovely weekend in the Auberge du vieux port. We traveled all the way from Pennsylvania, and had a great experience at this hotel. It is located in the center of Old Montreal. The location could not be any more perfect, as the street behind the hotel is lined with little shops and many excellent restaurants. The street in front of the hotel hosts the port, which is a great place to walk around. When we arrived the staff was very friendly and continued to offer their help and services through the extent of our stay. The room was gorgeous, with its tall ceilings and brick walls. It had all the European charm we had expected. The bathroom was also extremely clean and updated. I am a very strong critic of hotels, and often times find something wrong, however I had nothing to complain about with this one. The included breakfast was delicious and prepared to order, and the complimentary wine and cheese between 5 and 7 is very charming, especially when the jazz band plays on the weekends. The hotel is in walking distance to the cathedral and all activities in Old Montreal. It is also in walking distance to downtown, and all the main shopping areas. I highly recommend this hotel and would consider it a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, loft is OK if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Narrowgauge
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent if you want to be in the old port area. You can easily walk to restaurants. Itâ€™s a 10 minute walk to the metro. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed our stay. But there are things you should be aware of if youâ€™re thinking about staying in a loft. This applies only to the loft (apartment) number 603. The lofts are not in the inn, but two blocks from the rear door of the inn. Someone will help you get your bags there and back. There are no elevators. We couldnâ€™t figure out whether everybody in the building was a guest of the inn. It appeared that some were permanent residents, and that the inn just owned one or more apartments in the building. Loft #603 consists of one large (maybe 25 feet by 25 feet) room, a reasonably large bedroom, a smaller bedroom, a bathroom, an entrance hall and kitchen. Walls are exposed brick and stone; pipes and electrical cables are exposed. The fireplace doesnâ€™t work, and neither did the TV in the large room. The TV in the large bedroom did work but you have to string an extension cord through the door and plug it into an outlet in the large room. WiFi worked pretty well. Lighting is inadequate: one person can sit next to the table lamp and have enough light to read comfortably, but others will find the light a little dim for reading. The cord for the lamp by the bedroom runs into the wall, then inside the wall to a spot several feet away where it emerges and is plugged into an outlet. This is beyond strange; it is a fire hazard. It can get noisy. The people downstairs had a party that included children playing hockey in the hall. Someone upstairs rose each day at 6:30, flushed the toilet 15 or 20 times, then woke the children and got them started practicing their Morris dancing. OK, I exaggerate a little, but you will hear every flush, foot step and (muffled) conversation. Luckily, with the exception of the party night, people went to bed fairly early and we didnâ€™t really find the noise too bothersome. The large bedroom has a glass door, reducing privacy. The water heater has enough hot water for only two showers. Housekeeping makes the beds and changes the towels each day. If youâ€™re not cooking your own in the loftâ€™s kitchen, breakfast is in the inn and itâ€™s $10 (not included with the room as it would be if you were staying in the inn.) Our breakfasts were excellent and the service was prompt and courteous. We arranged through the hotel for transportation to the hotel from the airport and back; it was reliable and pleasant. However, we were told by the hotel that the trip to the hotel would be $101 including tax and tip, and that the trip from the hotel would be somewhat less. We paid for both trips when we returned to the airport, and the bill was $232 not including tip. Itâ€™s about 20 minutes each way; Iâ€™d bet a cab would have been quite a bit less. For comparison, here in overpriced New Jersey a roughly equivalent round trip was $100 including tax and a pretty generous tip.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of charm - and a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: jampling
Reviews.Content: This lovely auberge has a lot going for it: a brilliant location in the heart of vieux Montreal; very large and attractive rooms with bare beams, exposed brick, hardwood floors, and large windows - ours looked out over the river. The ensuite bathroom was a dream: wonderfully spacious and well equipped with an abundance of fluffy towels and quality products, a shower with lashings of hot water and a separate jacuzzi tub. Fabulous! Breakfasts were good. A continental breakfast buffet was laid out, together with menu service that included full English breakfasts, omelettes, pancakes etc. We also enjoyed an excellent dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant. Quirks? As has been mentioned by other guests, there seems to be some under-staffing. Although courteous, friendly and ultimately responsive, the front desk staff person is also responsible for answering the phone and taking reservations - which can mean quite a wait for incoming or outgoing guests. When we arrived, our room was extremely cold, in part due to a faulty thermostat and not helped by the faulty window sealing which allowed frigid Montreal air to whistle through. The brick wall beside the window was also crumbling in places, resulting in small piles of dust and brick fragments on the windowsill and floor. We also expressed disappointment to the front desk that here was no means to make coffee or tea in the room. By the time we returned to our room that afternoon, a portable heater was waiting for us, together with what appeared to be a brand new coffee maker - complete with coffee, cream etc. That's service! All in, an experience that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Given Away”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsGood-Travel
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a big favor by calling the hotel if you are arriving late. If you donâ€™t, they will give it away then blaming on the online booking system. It happens to us even with credit card deposit guaranteed. It ruined our trip to Montreal totally.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: s1nead
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending four nights at the Auberge du Vieux-Port and had a FANTASTIC time!!! We checked in on September 22 until September 26, 2008. The main part of the hotel is located RIGHT on Rue de la Commune which is directly on the riverfront where romantic horse drawn carriages stroll by all day. Across the street is the wharf where the bateaux-mouche dock and the bike path begins. Around the corner is the Jacques Cartier Square ....... This is where we checked-in but we knew in advance that we would be staying in one of their off-site Lofts. However, from the moment of our check-in, we knew we were in for an excellent experience! Fredrique escorted us ((and carried our luggage)) to our loft around the corner on Rue de Vincent which is an EXCELLENT location. Our loft is in a 119 year old building. The lofts are all BEAUTIFULLY & rustically renovated warehouses ...... open ceilings, exposed brick, water pipes, etc ...... Next door is a fantastic Italian restaurant ((Galliano's)) where we had TWO delicious dinners. Although our loft ((#604 ~~ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)) was up SIX flights of stairs (with NO elevator), we would not want to ever stay anywhere else! #604 is over 900 square feet. Please see our scans to get a complete idea of how extraordinary was this loft! The side of the room overlooking Rue de Vincent had four floor to ceiling, double windows. Most of the walls are exposed stone and used brick. There is a WORKING fireplace, WITH wood provided! Although we did not need it, the loft is air conditioned and the heating works great. We didn't have time to prepare meals but the kitchenette is well equipped for our needs....... microwave....... frig .... everything .... There are two dining tables ~~ formal & informal. The furnishings are soooo comfortable and welcoming. Take a look at that fantastic BED!!!! Wireless, CD player, TV, closet space, bath ~~ all great. Comfortable couch and easy chairs..... Desk .......excellent lighting ..... The king size bed and linens are LUXIOURIOUS!! We had daily maid service ..... bath linens are great. At night, the view from our loft was breathtaking! While sitting on the couch, we could see the beautifully lit dome of the Marche Bonsecours down the street ...... Below us, Rue de Vincent bustled but was very quiet ...... we never were bothered by noise during our entire stay. Right next door to our loft is a washing machine & dryer but we did not need to use it. EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT!!!!! We only paid $169.00 a night! Because we were not staying in the main Hotel, we were not entitled to a free breakfast ..... but it only cost us $10.00 and it was GREAT! Also, Loft Guests had extended breakfast privileges until 11:00. Because we are late sleepers, this worked out perfectly. As explained by previous reviewers, breakfast is served in a cozy restaurant below the Hotel Desk. Service was always excellent. We never felt rushed, food was always complete and plentiful and our servers were always friendly, professional and delightful. Our selections included omelets, eggs, waffles, pancakes, assorted breads & croissants, cereals, muffins, fruits, etc ... The Hotel Staff at Auberge du Vieux-Port was always extremely friendly and helpful. LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!!!!!! We didn't rent a car and didn't need one .... so much was within walking distance and our four days were not nearly enough time to scratch the surface. One morning, we took a tour on the Bateau-Mouche..... relaxing and wonderful ..... Another morning, we rented bikes at Ca Roule ....... biked to the Marche where we bought picnic sandwiches, cheeses, etc & drinks ....... and then biked along the Lachine Canal to the Parc where we ate our picnic lunch on the banks of the St Lawrence River and then we biked back!!! Thirty Miles, we were told , but it was soooooooooooooo worth it (we are 58 & 60 years old and it was a not-too-miss experience.) I was taught by the Sisters of the Congregation de Notre Dame de Montreal (in New York) so I really enjoyed the Bourgeoys Museum and the Bonsecours Chapel. Even my husband (an Episcopalian) was impressed ...... One night, we bought tickets for a light show at the Notre-Dame Basilica. It was called: "Lumiere Fut" and was a little cheesy in spots but, overall, a FANTASTIC show! The Basilica (where Celine Dion was married) is gorgeous during the day but SPECTACULAR at night. Don't miss the Pointe-a-Calliere Museum (Museum of Archaeology and History) ~~ VERY well done. Montreal is very proud of its extremely important history and the Pointe offers a great introduction and over-view to it. Although very French, Old Montreal is completely bilingual and everyone we met was extremely friendly and fun. We live in San Diego but we BOTH want to return to Vieux Montreal...... it was an unforgettable trip ........

Reviews.Title: “Greet the staff and get prepared for an argument about almost everything”
Reviews.Author: stoler
Reviews.Content: such a disappointment from beginning to end. The unhelpful disinterested arrogant staff watched us spiral out of control without helping to give any ideas for visiting local attractions to eating at local restaurants. Just avoid the breakfast, it takes way too long, they run out of supplies anyway and treat you as if you are a real "bother" to be ignored and you're taking up valuable time in their day. The "deluxe" room had trash pickup at 5am in the morning outside your window. Hope that you like lots of morning noise. The hotel should take a course 101 in welcoming guests, especially tourism and making people feel special and happy that they chose to stay there over all the hundreds of places to stay in montreal. In retrospect, we should have chosen another place that a friend recommended. We are Very sad because, this completely ruined our trip to Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: IMFozzieBear
Reviews.Content: When booking a small hotel in a large city never previously visited, one never knows if you have chosen wisely regarding location, cleanliness, amenities, etc. I must have looked at 100 places in Montreal when planning where we would spend our 35th anniversary, and Auberge du Vieux-Port was absolutely the perfect choice. Excellent linens including robes, high end bath products, multiple breakfast choices such as crepes & omelette's (included) in addition to the buffet evening cheese and a glass of wine (also included). The fact that a small hotel in an old building has an elevator is a rare treat! The location is ideal as it is easy to access the rest of the city via subway or bus from the hotel, and you are in the heart of Old Montreal, which is the part of town to simply walk and enjoy. Some of the very old aspects of the building have been preserved, like stone walls, but everything else is very up to date. Our room, which had an immense jacuzzi tub plus separate shower, did not face the river, of which we were actually glad since that street tends to be very busy and therefore noisy all the time. Our only disappointment was the rooftop restaurant; the on-line pictures made it look like a place for a special event dinner when it's really only a place to stop for one drink, but there are a multitude of wonderful restaurants very near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: doctravel30
Reviews.Content: A charming old-world boutique hotel, the Auberge du Vieux Port is ideally located with a view of the St. Lawrence River. My husband and I spent five nights in a Deluxe King room which was beautifully decorated. The artwork in the bedroom, corridor and also the bathroom was tasteful and unique. We particularly liked the hardwood floors, exposed beams and stone wall in the room. Robes, slippers and an umbrella were included. The staff was especially accommodating and friendly. Michael, an exceptional and very pleasant concierge, suggested restaurants as well as sights and always asked our opinion of the places we visited. He really went out of his way to be helpful, concerned and considerate. Because we arrived in September we didnâ€™t get to have the rooftop breakfast, a service that ends August 31; however, the breakfast in the lower-level restaurant was very nice. A nightly wine and cheese cocktail hour between 5 and 7 PM was included in the priceâ€”a very nice touch. They even had live music. I reserved the room by phone because I wanted to check on parking. I discovered that it would have been better to make the reservation online. Apparently the person I spoke to failed to include my request for a separate shower. However, this issue was resolved quickly and to our satisfaction. We had a lovely room. Although the following problem didnâ€™t affect my rave reviews of the hotel I must mention it. I was told that my car would be in an underground garage. I didnâ€™t use my car during our stay. When we were ready to leave we were originally told by Daniel that it would take ten minutes to get the car. A half-hour later, as we waited in the lobby with our luggage, Daniel, who had been mostly amiable during our stay, suddenly became annoyed and instead of apologizing for the delay he was rather curt when we asked how much longer weâ€™d have to wait. When my car was retrieved I discovered it was parked, not in an underground garage, but outside in a tiny lot. We were eager to get on the road so I didnâ€™t question this. I do suggest that anyone wishing to park at the hotel find out exactly where they put cars. In conclusion, our overall experience was very positive and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a delightful place to spend time in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest!”
Reviews.Author: foodie68
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we never actually had the chance to stay at this hotel... Why, you ask? Well, we received a $200 gift certificate to the hotel as a wedding present. When we finally found a weekend in which to use it (just over 1.5 years later, and after them granting us one "extension")... we discovered the hotel would no longer accept it. They simply had a policy that certificates expire after 1 year (1.5 years if you beg). To think the hotel actually took $200 as payment for a service, and then placed an arbitrary deadline on redeeming this! Terrible! I wouldn't do business with such a business ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LondonOnLondoner
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, small, quaint boutique-type hotel with all the charm of surrounding Old Montreal. The service (especially Michael), the rooms, the restaurants and the ambience were just what I was hoping for. Full concierge service, full breakfast included in stay, wine and cheese with jazz music included, turndown service and even monogrammed robes and umbrellas in the room. The 'river-view' room was a little noisy during the night, but the other perks made it worthwhile. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, clean and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: JONNParis
Reviews.Content: Extremely attractive rooms, and I was lucky enough to have one with a wide view over the river. Bed extremely comfortable, bathroom facilities excellent. Copious breakfast, although unfortunately served in a rather dark basement dining-room. Staff on the whole very efficient and pleasant, though with one unfortunate exception. Generally speaking highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “some kinks but enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nites at the auberge- 7/3 and 7/4. we reserved a deluxe king room and checked into the room, the a/c was not working. we were told to give it some time. so we went out and enjoyed the city. came back after 11pm and the a/c was still not working. the night manager came up to check and said that it was broken and brought us 2 fans. it was fairly hot that nite and we didn't sleep well. the next morining we spoke to the manager- he was very busy but after he gave us his undivided attention, he switched us to a different room with functioning a/c and ended up comping us the first nite. we would have rather been comfortable the first nite than have it for free but ok. both rooms and bathrooms were very spacious with brick and stone . the hotel itself was nicely renovated and is comfortable and charming. there is a breakfast room in the basement that is lovely and a rooftop bar with river views. asked the staff for restaurant recommendations and ended up at an excellent italian trattoria -cafe via dante in petite italie- not touristy at all with wonderful food and service and noot crazy expensive. the next nite we ended up at chao phraya, an excellent thai place in a non touristy residential part of town. so but for the a/c issues, i would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tourist1957
Reviews.Content: My family spent 4 nights at this hotel in late June 2008. We had 2 rooms overlooking the main road. The rooms were charming, much the same as shown in the photos provided on the website. Exposed brick, wood floors. It is a really old building but the rooms are renovated and charming. They are also a good size. Breakfast was served in the basement which is also very nice. The only negative to the experience is the street can be somewhat noisy, but with the windows shut, it was not a problem. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. One of the 4 nights was spent in an apartment managed by the hotel in a different building. We changed our plans late and they could not get us a 4th night in the main auberge. The apt was OK and actually a great value at just over $200 a night for a 2 bedroom unit. While it was nice, the main auberge is a much nicer experience, but if you are looking for something more affordable, it is a solid choice. The hotel is in a nice part of the city with restaurants everywhere, although a bit pricey. It's about a 6 block easy walk to the metro. We highly recommend this hotel. We tend to be really fussy and not shy to voice complaints, but really had none during this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stimpson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early March. The hotel is in an excellent location in Old Montreal. The hotel is gorgeous very European. The staff is absolutely excellent, and are truly there to serve you. The rooms have hardwood floors and are very comfortable. Old Montreal at this time of the year is quite dead, the restaurants close early and I didn't think there was much to do. We ended up spending the majority of our time downtown which is about a 15 minute walk from Old Montreal. I have been to Old Montreal in the summer and it is definitely more lively than it is in the winter-spring.

Reviews.Title: “Staff neglected to tell us some things”
Reviews.Author: NYCHRIS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is one of the most picturesque in old Montreal.We stayed in the lofts, which(we were not told)were about a block and a half away above a restaurant that's owned by the hotel.There was no lift and it was a 2 story walkup-again we were not informed.The lofts are spacious, but the furniture in ours was old and worn.My friends rooms furniture was much nicer.The beds are huge-kings-and pretty comfortable.A huge problem was the windows.I don't know about the rest, but #804 does not have double paned glass and it is very noisy at night and you can hear everything.We only stayed for a night, but that was a big concern.The staff was very helpful,especially the concierge/doorman.They offer valet parking for a fee and will retrieve your car at any time.They also gave us an extended checkout.The hotel itself looks real nice,especially the main restaurant and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in the heart of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: AmazingChan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Montreal for a long weekend getaway and chose the Auberge du Vieux-Port after a quick web search. The hotel consists of five separate buildings, located along the riverside in Old Montreal. We chose a loft apartment, which was clean and well equipped with large windows looking out onto the street. As some reviewers have mentioned, the lofts are not brand new or designer chic, but they are very cosy and comfortable, like a well lived in apartment, with lots of exposed brick and timber floors. The kitchen was roomy and well-equipped, although we didn't use it as the local restaurants are excellent. Like most New Zealanders we don't speak a word of French, but the hotel staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. If you are staying in Old Montreal, it's well worth renting a bicycle and cycling along the riverside. There are over 300km of bike tracks throughout the city and it's a great way to look around. We had a great stay at the Auberge and recommend it to anyone visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Richard060
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights in early April and couldn't have been happier with our choice. Room furnishings, desk service, bathrooms etc. were all excellent, but it was a few extra touches with which we were most impressed. First, there is a wine and cheese between 5:00 and 7:00, which was lovely. Guests get a free glass of wine and can nibble on brie and gouda served with fresh baguette. Also, guests get free breakfast. Not "continental", as is the norm, but hot, cooked, from-a-menu breakfast. Overall, this hotel was a big part of a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay !”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveller1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in March 2008. We very much enjoyed the excellent service. The staff was friendly and very helpful to recommend restaurants and provide directions. The room was very nice with high celings, stylish furnishings and a very nice jacuzzi tub. The only drawback is that the walls seem a bit thin and you can hear street sounds and anyone next door. But, I would highly recommend this hotel and congratualte the staff on an excellent job !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn with a personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: K2C
Reviews.Content: Top notch customer service very clean rooms with quality linens. The Inn has a lovely ambiance and the staff are very welcoming and more than helpful (in English or French). An early arrival in Montreal mid January meant we were at the hotel earlier than expected. We were checked in and given great directions for our itinerary over the next few days, not to mention a few other useful tips and places to visit. I even noticed one of the managers have a discussion with staff on the best fruit to have in the foyer for the clients. Attention to detail seemed to be where their mindset is. The complimentary cheese and wine for the guests served 5-7pm is a great touch. The little bar is cozy, and with some jazz in the evening there wasn't much of an urge to head out to the cold Montreal streets to sightsee. Location is great to visit the Old City and Notre Dame is only 6 or 7 minutes walk away. A tip to go to the Jean Talon market proved invaluable to us foodies. I could go on but....try it out, makes a great winter getaway. K2C

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous building - Great service”
Reviews.Author: itsjustlynn
Reviews.Content: We booked on short notice and based on the website pictures and some reviews. As always, you never know if the actual hotel is as beautiful as the pictures on the website, there was no doubt we were in the right place. It was warm (considering it was February and -25C without the wind), not pretentious (but classy) and the staff were pleasant, helpful and volunteered useful information. Some hotels you have to do all the work by asking 100 questions, they answered your questions before you could even ask. We were lucky to be upgraded and had a beautiful King Size room with double jacuzzi with a view of the river. The room was welcoming and warm, the food was delicious and the rates were very reasonable. A rare find - definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place...”
Reviews.Author: koskuba
Reviews.Content: Although it was a better buy a few years ago with the exchange rate and increases, it's still a great respite in Old Montreal. If you want a ton of amenties like a gym, go to the Omni- otherwise, for quaint, charming, comfort- choose the Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “Still a charmer, but could use some improvements....”
Reviews.Author: skeezixtoronto
Reviews.Content: We have not stayed at the Auberge du Vieux Port for a few years, so we figured it was time to revisit this old favourite. The hotel still has its charms, but this year is its 10th anniversary, and the hotel is showing its age in small ways. The upholstered bench in our room had a noticeable hole in the corner, with the stuffing coming out. The caulking around the bathroom sink was all mildewy and deteriorating -- it ought to have been replaced ages ago. That sort of thing. Nothing major, but it all adds up. Also, the Narcisse, the new wine bar, is not as nice as the old Les Remparts restaurant, either in atmosphere or menu. However, the service continues to be impeccable. Staff are friendly and helpful at all times -- they certainly made the stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBoston
Reviews.Content: I waited until the last minute to book a trip to Montreal and had few choices as to where to stay. I saw Auberge Vieux du Port and it looked nice so I blindly took a chance. Sometimes dumb luck is the best way to travel. On the way up to Montreal, I took a recent copy of Conde Nast with their annual readers' poll. Turns out Auberge was the number 1 hotel in Montreal and number 7 in all of Canada. I understand why it gets high marks. The staff is outstanding, the hotel is adorable, the location is perfect, and there are so many little things they do well. I was on my own, but was always comfortable and well taken care of. The concierge gave me her card when I checked in -- just in case I had any questions while out and about, and then called my room to make sure that "everything was perfect." There is a wine and cheese reception in the bar each evening. The bedding rivaled top hotels in Europe. And I could not have been happier in the Old Port section of Montreal. It is magical at night when the lights come on, there are adorable shops, restaurants galore, and art galleries to poke around in. The food scene in Montreal is amazing. I had some of the best meals ever, and felt that had I chosen other restaurants, I still would have. There are so many to choose from. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a boutique, well serviced, comfortable experience. Oh, and their restaurant was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stoney36
Reviews.Content: We needed a break and this hotel was the answer in spades...from the moment we arrived until the concierge got us in our cab complete with coffees...what a lovely property...the room was so charming and the linens soft and luxurious...beautiful breakfasts each morning and wine and cheese after a full day of shopping just steps from the front door in Old Montreal...we'll defineatley be back...I think this will be an annual tradition for us now....romantic...and we can't say enough about the staff...they were amazing...thanks for a much needed getaway...we're ready for the real world again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vieux-Port....”
Reviews.Author: mosNj
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Auberge in mid-October, and found the location, service staff, and rooms all that we would have wanted.Also, the buffet breakfast served in a wine-cellar-like room was very good. Although we were initially disappointed that their restaurant, Les Remparts, had recently closed, the concierge made us reservations at other highly recommended places including Restaurant Bonaparte and Pinxto (Spanish tapas).The valet brought our car within 10 minutes each time we requested it and everyone working at the hotel, including the breakfast-room server, went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. In fact, when the woman in charge of breakfast noticed that my husband was making a hot chocolate from the buffet, she offered to go to the kitchen and make a cup with better cocoa and milk (not water). A small nicety, perhaps, but an example of the staff's generous attitude. We liked walking to most places, and the archeology museum and Science center with Imax theater are right nearby, as is Rue St. Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jdfre123
Reviews.Content: We were staying at one of the lofts which are owned by the hotel. On arrival, the staff were helpful and attentive and drove us from the hotel to our apartment located within 50 metres of the hotel. The 2-bedroomed apartment was in an old converted building and beautifully furnished. The location of the loft, in Montreal's old town, was perfect and there were many resturants, street entertainers and shops within a 2 minute walk. Our car was valet parked by the hotel staff and was brought to us whenever we needed it within 10 minutes of a phone call to reception. Our only criticisms of the lofts du vieux port were that the apartment proved to be quite dark and the lighting wasn't sufficient, plus the front bedroom, which faced onto the street was very noisy at night due to the downstairs restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. The staff courteous and professional. We were pleased with the room, the breakfast and wine and cheese included. The restaurant was first rate as well. We have traveled quite a bit and found this hotel to be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetamandkarrishow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at Auberge du Vieux-Port in July 2007 and it was wonderful. Our room was very large and the bathroom was huge. The staff was very helpful. I will definietly stay here again. Just two small issues- our room was right next to the stairs that lead up to the terrace. The noise level was excessive at times. Also, I would have liked the bathroom lighting to be a little brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Spent Honeymoon Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: kim33176
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I had high expectations about the Auberge du Vieux-Port when we arrived. We had seen pictures on the website...but were so disappointed with our stay there. This was our first stay on our honeymoon -- 2 nights at Auberge before heading onto Quebec. It was unseasonably warm during our stay in Montreal and our room was located on the top floor. During the middle of the night, a rainstorm came through and the ceiling broke and water ended up dripping onto our bed. We had to physically move the bed to make sure there was not going to be water damage. The air conditioning did little to improve the situation -- it was stifling in our room. We must admit -- we had a wonderful service during out stay...with many apologies from the conceirge. They waved our parking fee -- but that was about it. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot..”
Reviews.Author: fdurdh
Reviews.Content: The Auberge is quite a romantic place to stay in an utterly romantic town! The rooms are gorgeous, the staff works overtime to make sure everything is comfortable. My only advice is to try and get a room that faces the port...the street side can get a little noisy with all the merriment going on in old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great service terrible food!”
Reviews.Author: felixsangelbaby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week-end in old Montreal. We had reserved a room at the Auberge and paid extra for a river view. A view, in my mind, would mean that you would have a clear view of the river but unless you were on the fourth or fifth floor this was not the case. The hotel is at a great location... close to shops and pubs and the service was phenomenal but do not get the package that includes a four course meal. First of all you do not get to choose the four courses and the majority of the meal was inedible. The ceviche was more like sashimi, the lobster ravioli was terrible and the fois gras was fois gras. The only thing that saved the meal was the filet mignon... it was delicious. But I could have saved money and eaten a better meal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a most enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: noahark
Reviews.Content: While our directions from Expedia left us in the middle of somewhere and we had to call someone at 2am at home to get proper directions we arrived quite weary. The doorman was not there, but the front desk clerk was more than happy to assist us with our luggage. The room was warm and roomy. The windows were huge which provided us with much sunshine and a great view. The wood floors were a nice touch. We were there during the coldest week in Jan. many of the shops and restaurants were closed until April. The staff was more than happy to assist at any moment, especially with dining recommendations. Mattieu, the doorman, went out of his way for us many times, to call a taxi or bring us something that we left in the car. The cheeses at the wine reception were excellent as were the breakfasts. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! The location is easily accesible to any area of Old Montreal and Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Wimsey
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe double room with a view of the river at the Auberge du Vieux Port for under $200.00 per night. The price included breakfast, an evening cocktail hour, a Jacuzzi tub, and I thought I was getting a great deal. However, the hotel didnâ€™t live up to my expectations even for the price. Iâ€™ve stayed at several boutique hotels in Montreal and Quebec City, but I didnâ€™t find the Vieux Port up to par.
